121.7: Jehovah preserveth thee from all evil, He doth preserve thy soul.
121.3: He suffereth not thy foot to be moved, Thy preserver slumbereth not.
121.2: My help [is] from Jehovah, maker of heaven and earth,
121.1: A Song of the Ascents. I lift up mine eyes unto the hills, Whence doth my help come?
121.4: Lo, He slumbereth not, nor sleepeth, He who is preserving Israel.
121.6: By day the sun doth not smite thee, Nor the moon by night.
121.5: Jehovah [is] thy preserver, Jehovah [is] thy shade on thy right hand,
121.8: Jehovah preserveth thy going out and thy coming in, From henceforth even unto the age!

31.16: Cause Thy face to shine on Thy servant, Save me in Thy kindness.
31.3: For my rock and my bulwark [art] Thou, For Thy name's sake lead me and tend me.
31.5: Into Thy hand I commit my spirit, Thou hast redeemed me, Jehovah God of truth.
31.21: Blessed [is] Jehovah, For He hath made marvellous His kindness To me in a city of bulwarks.
31.18: Let lips of falsehood become dumb, That are speaking against the righteous, Ancient sayings, in pride and contempt.
31.12: I have been forgotten as dead out of mind, I have been as a perishing vessel.
31.10: For my life hath been consumed in sorrow And my years in sighing. Feeble because of mine iniquity hath been my strength, And my bones have become old.
31.2: Incline unto me Thine ear hastily, deliver me, Be to me for a strong rock, For a house of bulwarks to save me.
31.22: And I -- I have said in my haste, 'I have been cut off from before Thine eyes,' But Thou hast heard the voice of my supplications, In my crying unto Thee.
31.8: And Thou hast not shut me up, Into the hand of an enemy, Thou hast caused my feet to stand in a broad place.
31.17: O Jehovah, let me not be ashamed, For I have called Thee, let the wicked be ashamed, Let them become silent to Sheol.
31.11: Among all mine adversaries I have been a reproach, And to my neighbours exceedingly, And a fear to mine acquaintances, Those seeing me without -- fled from me.
31.1: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. In Thee, O Jehovah, I have trusted, Let me not be ashamed to the age, In Thy righteousness deliver me.
31.9: Favour me, O Jehovah, for distress [is] to me, Mine eye, my soul, and my body Have become old by provocation.
31.24: Be strong, and He strengtheneth your heart, All ye who are waiting for Jehovah!
31.14: And I on Thee -- I have trusted, O Jehovah, I have said, 'Thou [art] my God.'
31.7: I rejoice, and am glad in Thy kindness, In that Thou hast seen mine affliction, Thou hast known in adversities my soul.
31.15: In Thy hand [are] my times, Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, And from my pursuers.
31.20: Thou hast wrought for those trusting in Thee, Before sons of men. Thou hidest them in the secret place of Thy presence, From artifices of man, Thou concealest them in a tabernacle, From the strife of tongues.
31.23: Love Jehovah, all ye His saints, Jehovah is keeping the faithful, And recompensing abundantly a proud doer.
31.6: I have hated the observers of lying vanities, And I toward Jehovah have been confident.
31.4: Bring me out from the net that they hid for me, For Thou [art] my strength.
31.19: How abundant is Thy goodness, That Thou hast laid up for those fearing Thee,
31.13: For I have heard an evil account of many, Fear [is] round about. In their being united against me, To take my life they have devised,

117.2: For mighty to us hath been His kindness, And the truth of Jehovah [is] to the age. Praise ye Jah!
117.1: Praise Jehovah, all ye nations, Glorify Him, all ye peoples.

59.16: And I -- I sing [of] Thy strength, And I sing at morn [of] Thy kindness, For thou hast been a tower to me, And a refuge for me in a day of adversity.
59.3: For, lo, they laid wait for my soul, Assembled against me are strong ones, Not my transgression nor my sin, O Jehovah.
59.5: And Thou, Jehovah, God of Hosts, God of Israel, Awake to inspect all the nations. Favour not any treacherous dealers of iniquity. Selah.
59.12: The sin of their mouth [is] a word of their lips, And they are captured in their pride, And from the curse and lying they recount.
59.10: God doth go before me, He causeth me to look on mine enemies.
59.2: Deliver me from workers of iniquity, And from men of blood save me.
59.8: And Thou, O Jehovah dost laugh at them, Thou dost mock at all the nations.
59.17: O my Strength, unto Thee I sing praise, For God [is] my tower, the God of my kindness!
59.11: Slay them not, lest my people forget, Shake them by Thy strength, And bring them down, O Lord our shield.
59.1: To the Overseer. -- 'Destroy not,' by David. -- A secret treasure, in Saul's sending, and they watch the house to put him to death. Deliver me from mine enemies, O my God, From my withstanders set me on high.
59.9: O my Strength, unto Thee I take heed, For God [is] my tower -- the God of my kindness.
59.14: And they turn back at evening, They make a noise like a dog, And they go round about the city.
59.7: Lo, they belch out with their mouths, Swords [are] in their lips, for 'Who heareth?'
59.15: They -- they wander for food, If they are not satisfied -- then they murmur.
59.6: They turn back at evening, They make a noise like a dog, And go round about the city.
59.4: Without punishment they run and prepare themselves, Stir up to meet me, and see.
59.13: Consume in fury, consume and they are not, And they know that God is ruling in Jacob, To the ends of the earth. Selah.

5.7: And I, in the abundance of Thy kindness, I enter Thy house, I bow myself toward Thy holy temple in Thy fear.
5.9: For there is no stability in their mouth. Their heart [is] mischiefs, An open grave [is] their throat, Their tongue they make smooth.
5.10: Declare them guilty, O God, Let them fall from their own counsels, In the abundance of their transgressions Drive them away, Because they have rebelled against Thee.
5.3: Jehovah, [at] morning Thou hearest my voice, [At] morning I set in array for Thee, And I look out.
5.11: And rejoice do all trusting in Thee, To the age they sing, and Thou coverest them over, And those loving Thy name exult in Thee.
5.2: Be attentive to the voice of my cry, My king and my God, For unto Thee I pray habitually.
5.1: To the Overseer, 'Concerning the Inheritances.' -- A Psalm of David. My sayings hear, O Jehovah, Consider my meditation.
5.12: For Thou blessest the righteous, O Jehovah, As a buckler with favour dost compass him!
5.4: For not a God desiring wickedness [art] Thou, Evil inhabiteth Thee not.
5.6: Thou destroyest those speaking lies, A man of blood and deceit Jehovah doth abominate.
5.5: The boastful station not themselves before Thine eyes: Thou hast hated all working iniquity.
5.8: O Jehovah, lead me in Thy righteousness, Because of those observing me, Make straight before me Thy way,

53.3: Every one went back, together they became filthy, There is none doing good -- not even one.
53.2: God from the heavens looked on the sons of men, To see if there be an understanding one, [One] seeking God.
53.1: To the Overseer. -- 'On a disease.' -- An instruction, by David. A fool said in his heart, 'There is no God.' They have done corruptly, Yea, they have done abominable iniquity, There is none doing good.
53.4: Have not workers of iniquity known, Those eating my people have eaten bread, God they have not called.
53.6: Who doth give from Zion the salvation of Israel? When God turneth back [to] a captivity of His people, Jacob doth rejoice -- Israel is glad!
53.5: There they feared a fear -- there was no fear, For God hath scattered the bones of him Who is encamping against thee, Thou hast put to shame, For God hath despised them.

47.7: For king of all the earth [is] God, Give praise, O understanding one.
47.9: Nobles of peoples have been gathered, [With] the people of the God of Abraham, For to God [are] the shields of earth, Greatly hath He been exalted!
47.3: He leadeth peoples under us, and nations under our feet.
47.2: For Jehovah Most High [is] fearful, A great king over all the earth.
47.1: To the Overseer. -- By sons of Korah. A Psalm. All ye peoples, clap the hand, Shout to God with a voice of singing,
47.4: He doth choose for us our inheritance, The excellency of Jacob that He loves. Selah.
47.6: Praise God -- praise -- give praise to our king, praise.
47.5: God hath gone up with a shout, Jehovah with the sound of a trumpet.
47.8: God hath reigned over nations, God hath sat on His holy throne,

100.2: Serve Jehovah with joy, come before him with singing.
100.4: Enter ye His gates with thanksgiving, His courts with praise, Give ye thanks to Him, bless ye His Name.
100.5: For good [is] Jehovah, to the age His kindness, And to generation and generation His faithfulness!
100.1: A Psalm of Thanksgiving. Shout to Jehovah, all the earth.
100.3: Know that Jehovah He [is] God, He made us, and we are His, His people -- and the flock of His pasture.

78.10: They have not kept the covenant of God, And in His law they have refused to walk,
78.63: His young men hath fire consumed, And His virgins have not been praised.
78.30: They have not been estranged from their desire, Yet [is] their food in their mouth,
78.49: He sendeth on them the fury of His anger, Wrath, and indignation, and distress -- A discharge of evil messengers.
78.62: And delivereth up to the sword His people, And with His inheritance shewed Himself angry.
78.22: For they have not believed in God, Nor have they trusted in His salvation.
78.13: He cleft a sea, and causeth them to pass over, Yea, He causeth waters to stand as a heap.
78.47: He destroyeth with hail their vine, And their sycamores with frost,
78.71: From behind suckling ones He hath brought him in, To rule over Jacob His people, And over Israel His inheritance.
78.3: That we have heard and do know, And our fathers have recounted to us.
78.8: And they are not like their fathers, A generation apostate and rebellious, A generation! it hath not prepared its heart, Nor stedfast with God [is] its spirit.
78.12: Before their fathers He hath done wonders, In the land of Egypt -- the field of Zoan.
78.65: And the Lord waketh as a sleeper, As a mighty one crying aloud from wine.
78.40: How often do they provoke Him in the wilderness, Grieve Him in the desolate place?
78.14: And leadeth them with a cloud by day, And all the night with a light of fire.
78.26: He causeth an east wind to journey in the heavens, And leadeth by His strength a south wind,
78.17: And they add still to sin against Him, To provoke the Most High in the dry place.
78.28: And causeth [it] to fall in the midst of His camp, Round about His tabernacles.
78.36: And -- they deceive Him with their mouth, And with their tongue do lie to Him,
78.4: We do not hide from their sons, To a later generation recounting praises of Jehovah, And His strength, and His wonders that He hath done.
78.50: He pondereth a path for His anger, He kept not back their soul from death, Yea, their life to the pestilence He delivered up.
78.45: He sendeth among them the beetle, and it consumeth them, And the frog, and it destroyeth them,
78.60: And He leaveth the tabernacle of Shiloh, The tent He had placed among men,
78.38: And He -- the Merciful One, Pardoneth iniquity, and destroyeth not, And hath often turned back His anger, And waketh not up all His fury.
78.23: And He commandeth clouds from above, Yea, doors of the heavens He hath opened.
78.51: And He smiteth every first-born in Egypt, The first-fruit of the strong in tents of Ham.
78.20: Lo, He hath smitten a rock, And waters flow, yea, streams overflow. 'Also -- bread [is] He able to give? Doth He prepare flesh for His people?'
78.59: God hath heard, and sheweth Himself wroth. And kicketh exceedingly against Israel.
78.69: And buildeth His sanctuary as a high place, Like the earth, He founded it to the age.
78.54: And He bringeth them in unto the border of His sanctuary, This mountain His right hand had got,
78.66: And He smiteth His adversaries backward, A reproach age-during He hath put on them,
78.57: And they turn back, And deal treacherously like their fathers, They have been turned like a deceitful bow,
78.43: When He set His signs in Egypt, And His wonders in the field of Zoan,
78.35: And they remember that God [is] their rock, And God Most High their redeemer.
78.41: Yea, they turn back, and try God, And the Holy One of Israel have limited.
78.5: And He raiseth up a testimony in Jacob, And a law hath placed in Israel, That He commanded our fathers, To make them known to their sons.
78.34: If He slew them, then they sought Him, And turned back, and sought God earnestly,
78.6: So that a later generation doth know, Sons who are born, do rise and recount to their sons,
78.53: And He leadeth them confidently, And they have not been afraid, And their enemies hath the sea covered.
78.2: I open with a simile my mouth, I bring forth hidden things of old,
78.44: And He turneth to blood their streams, And their floods they drink not.
78.72: And he ruleth them according to the integrity of his heart, And by the skilfulness of his hands leadeth them!
78.11: And they forget His doings, And His wonders that He shewed them.
78.70: And He fixeth on David His servant, And taketh him from the folds of a flock,
78.68: And He chooseth the tribe of Judah, With mount Zion that He loved,
78.1: An Instruction of Asaph. Give ear, O my people, to my law, Incline your ear to sayings of my mouth.
78.58: And make Him angry with their high places, And with their graven images make Him zealous,
78.55: And casteth out nations from before them, And causeth them to fall in the line of inheritance, And causeth the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents,
78.33: And He consumeth in vanity their days, And their years in trouble.
78.67: And He kicketh against the tent of Joseph, And on the tribe of Ephraim hath not fixed.
78.27: And He raineth on them flesh as dust, And as sand of the seas -- winged fowl,
78.16: And bringeth out streams from a rock, And causeth waters to come down as rivers.
78.64: His priests by the sword have fallen, And their widows weep not.
78.24: And He raineth on them manna to eat, Yea, corn of heaven He hath given to them.
78.19: And they speak against God -- they said: 'Is God able to array a table in a wilderness?'
78.29: And they eat, and are greatly satisfied, And their desire He bringeth to them.
78.61: And He giveth His strength to captivity, And His beauty into the hand of an adversary,
78.9: Sons of Ephraim -- armed bearers of bow, Have turned in a day of conflict.
78.37: And their heart hath not been right with Him, And they have not been stedfast in His covenant.
78.7: And place in God their confidence, And forget not the doings of God, But keep His commands.
78.52: And causeth His people to journey as a flock, And guideth them as a drove in a wilderness,
78.39: And He remembereth that they [are] flesh, A wind going on -- and it returneth not.
78.48: And delivereth up to the hail their beasts, And their cattle to the burning flames.
78.21: Therefore hath Jehovah heard, And He sheweth Himself wroth, And fire hath been kindled against Jacob, And anger also hath gone up against Israel,
78.56: And they tempt and provoke God Most High, And His testimonies have not kept.
78.46: And giveth to the caterpillar their increase, And their labour to the locust.
78.32: With all this they have sinned again, And have not believed in His wonders.
78.31: And the anger of God hath gone up against them, And He slayeth among their fat ones, And youths of Israel He caused to bend.
78.15: He cleaveth rocks in a wilderness, And giveth drink -- as the great deep.
78.25: Food of the mighty hath each eaten, Venison He sent to them to satiety.
78.18: And they try God in their heart, To ask food for their lust.
78.42: They have not remembered His hand The day He ransomed them from the adversary.

89.11: Thine [are] the heavens -- the earth also [is] Thine, The habitable world and its fulness, Thou hast founded them.
89.41: Spoiled him have all passing by the way, He hath been a reproach to his neighbours,
89.45: Thou hast shortened the days of his youth, Hast covered him over [with] shame. Selah.
89.42: Thou hast exalted the right hand of his adversaries, Thou hast caused all his enemies to rejoice.
89.3: I have made a covenant for My chosen, I have sworn to David My servant:
89.20: I have found David My servant, With My holy oil I have anointed him.
89.12: North and south Thou hast appointed them, Tabor and Hermon in Thy name do sing.
89.10: Thou hast bruised Rahab, as one wounded. With the arm of Thy strength Thou hast scattered Thine enemies.
89.17: For the beauty of their strength [art] Thou, And in Thy good will is our horn exalted,
89.51: Wherewith Thine enemies reproached, O Jehovah, Wherewith they have reproached The steps of Thine anointed.
89.44: Hast caused [him] to cease from his brightness, And his throne to the earth hast cast down.
89.40: Thou hast broken down all his hedges, Thou hast made his fenced places a ruin.
89.13: Thou hast an arm with might, Strong is Thy hand -- high Thy right hand.
89.27: I also first-born do appoint him, Highest of the kings of the earth.
89.30: If his sons forsake My law, And in My judgments do not walk;
89.18: For of Jehovah [is] our shield, And of the Holy One of Israel our king.
89.36: His seed is to the age, And his throne [is] as the sun before Me,
89.29: And I have set his seed for ever, And his throne as the days of the heavens.
89.23: And I have beaten down before him his adversaries, And those hating him I plague,
89.19: Then Thou hast spoken in vision, To Thy saint, yea, Thou sayest, I have placed help upon a mighty one, Exalted a chosen one out of the people,
89.1: An instruction, by Ethan the Ezrahite. Of the kind acts of Jehovah, to the age I sing, To all generations I make known Thy faithfulness with my mouth,
89.47: Remember, I pray Thee, what [is] life-time? Wherefore in vain hast Thou created All the sons of men?
89.5: and the heavens confess Thy wonders, O Jehovah, Thy faithfulness also [is] in an assembly of holy ones.
89.52: Blessed [is] Jehovah to the age. Amen, and amen!
89.49: Where [are] Thy former kindnesses, O Lord. Thou hast sworn to David in Thy faithfulness,
89.4: 'Even to the age do I establish thy seed, And have built to generation and generation thy throne. Selah.
89.8: O Jehovah, God of Hosts, Who [is] like Thee -- a strong Jah? And Thy faithfulness [is] round about Thee.
89.26: He proclaimeth me: 'Thou [art] my Father, My God, and the rock of my salvation.'
89.39: Hast rejected the covenant of Thy servant, Thou hast polluted to the earth his crown,
89.14: Righteousness and judgment [Are] the fixed place of Thy throne, Kindness and truth go before Thy face.
89.37: As the moon it is established -- to the age, And the witness in the sky is stedfast. Selah.
89.22: An enemy exacteth not upon him, And a son of perverseness afflicteth him not.
89.28: To the age I keep for him My kindness, And My covenant [is] stedfast with him.
89.25: And I have set on the sea his hand, And on the rivers his right hand.
89.9: Thou [art] ruler over the pride of the sea, In the lifting up of its billows Thou dost restrain them.
89.33: And My kindness I break not from him, Nor do I deal falsely in My faithfulness.
89.15: O the happiness of the people knowing the shout, O Jehovah, in the light of Thy face they walk habitually.
89.34: I profane not My covenant, And that which is going forth from My lips I change not.
89.21: With whom My hand is established, My arm also doth strengthen him.
89.24: And My faithfulness and kindness [are] with him, And in My name is his horn exalted.
89.46: Till when, O Jehovah, art Thou hidden? For ever doth Thy fury burn as fire?
89.16: In Thy name they rejoice all the day, And in Thy righteousness they are exalted,
89.35: Once I have sworn by My holiness, I lie not to David,
89.32: I have looked after with a rod their transgression, And with strokes their iniquity,
89.7: God is very terrible, In the secret counsel of His holy ones, And fearful over all surrounding Him.
89.43: Also -- Thou turnest back the sharpness of his sword, And hast not established him in battle,
89.48: Who [is] the man that liveth, and doth not see death? He delivereth his soul from the hand of Sheol. Selah.
89.2: For I said, 'To the age is kindness built, The heavens! Thou dost establish Thy faithfulness in them.'
89.38: And Thou, Thou hast cast off, and dost reject, Thou hast shown Thyself wroth With Thine anointed,
89.50: Remember, O Lord, the reproach of Thy servants, I have borne in my bosom all the strivings of the peoples,
89.6: For who in the sky, Compareth himself to Jehovah? Is like to Jehovah among sons of the mighty?
89.31: If My statutes they pollute, And My commands do not keep,

108.3: I thank Thee among peoples, O Jehovah, And I praise Thee among the nations.
108.5: Be Thou exalted above the heavens, O God, And above all the earth Thy honour.
108.12: Give to us help from adversity, And vain is the salvation of man.
108.10: Who doth bring me in to the fenced city? Who hath led me unto Edom?
108.2: Awake, psaltery and harp, I awake the dawn.
108.8: Mine [is] Gilead, mine [is] Manasseh, And Ephraim [is] the strength of my head, Judah [is] my lawgiver,
108.11: Hast not Thou, O God, cast us off? And Thou goest not out, O God, with our hosts!
108.1: A Song, a Psalm of David. Prepared is my heart, O God, I sing, yea, I sing praise, also my honour.
108.9: Moab [is] a pot for my washing, Upon Edom I cast my shoe, Over Philistia I shout habitually.
108.7: God hath spoken in His holiness: I exult, I apportion Shechem, And the valley of Succoth I measure,
108.6: That Thy beloved ones may be delivered, Save [with] Thy right hand, and answer us.
108.4: For great above the heavens [is] Thy kindness, And unto the clouds Thy truth.
108.13: In God we do mightily, And He doth tread down our adversaries!

39.3: Hot [is] my heart within me, In my meditating doth the fire burn, I have spoken with my tongue.
39.5: Lo, handbreadths Thou hast made my days, And mine age [is] as nothing before Thee, Only, all vanity [is] every man set up. Selah.
39.12: Hear my prayer, O Jehovah, And [to] my cry give ear, Unto my tear be not silent, For a sojourner I [am] with Thee, A settler like all my fathers.
39.10: Turn aside from off me Thy stroke, From the striving of Thy hand I have been consumed.
39.2: I was dumb [with] silence, I kept silent from good, and my pain is excited.
39.8: From all my transgressions deliver me, A reproach of the fool make me not.
39.11: With reproofs against iniquity, Thou hast corrected man, And dost waste as a moth his desirableness, Only, vanity [is] every man. Selah.
39.1: To the Overseer, to Jeduthun. -- A Psalm of David. I have said, 'I observe my ways, Against sinning with my tongue, I keep for my mouth a curb, while the wicked [is] before me.'
39.9: I have been dumb, I open not my mouth, Because Thou -- Thou hast done [it].
39.7: And, now, what have I expected? O Lord, my hope -- it [is] of Thee.
39.6: Only, in an image doth each walk habitually, Only, [in] vain, they are disquieted, He heapeth up and knoweth not who gathereth them.
39.4: 'Cause me to know, O Jehovah, mine end, And the measure of my days -- what it [is],' I know how frail I [am].
39.13: Look from me, and I brighten up before I go and am not!

110.7: From a brook in the way he drinketh, Therefore he doth lift up the head!

110.2: The rod of thy strength doth Jehovah send from Zion, Rule in the midst of thine enemies.
110.1: A Psalm of David. The affirmation of Jehovah to my Lord: 'Sit at My right hand, Till I make thine enemies thy footstool.'
110.4: Jehovah hath sworn, and doth not repent, 'Thou [art] a priest to the age, According to the order of Melchizedek.'

110.5: The Lord on thy right hand smote kings In the day of His anger.

51.16: For Thou desirest not sacrifice, or I give [it], Burnt-offering Thou acceptest not.
51.3: For my transgressions I do know, And my sin [is] before me continually.
51.5: Lo, in iniquity I have been brought forth, And in sin doth my mother conceive me.
51.18: Do good in Thy good pleasure with Zion, Thou dost build the walls of Jerusalem.
51.12: Restore to me the joy of Thy salvation, And a willing spirit doth sustain me.
51.10: A clean heart prepare for me, O God, And a right spirit renew within me.
51.2: Thoroughly wash me from mine iniquity, And from my sin cleanse me,
51.8: Thou causest me to hear joy and gladness, Thou makest joyful bones Thou hast bruised.
51.17: The sacrifices of God [are] a broken spirit, A heart broken and bruised, O God, Thou dost not despise.
51.11: Cast me not forth from Thy presence, And Thy Holy Spirit take not from me.
51.1: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David, in the coming in unto him of Nathan the prophet, when he hath gone in unto Bath-Sheba. Favour me, O God, according to Thy kindness, According to the abundance of Thy mercies, Blot out my transgressions.
51.9: Hide Thy face from my sin. And all mine iniquities blot out.
51.14: Deliver me from blood, O God, God of my salvation, My tongue singeth of Thy righteousness.
51.7: Thou cleansest me with hyssop and I am clean, Washest me, and than snow I am whiter.
51.15: O Lord, my lips thou dost open, And my mouth declareth Thy praise.
51.6: Lo, truth Thou hast desired in the inward parts, And in the hidden part Wisdom Thou causest me to know.
51.4: Against Thee, Thee only, I have sinned, And done the evil thing in Thine eyes, So that Thou art righteous in Thy words, Thou art pure in Thy judging.
51.19: Then Thou desirest sacrifices of righteousness, Burnt-offering, and whole burnt-offering, Then they offer bullocks on thine altar!
51.13: I teach transgressors Thy ways, And sinners unto Thee do return.

144.3: Jehovah, what [is] man that Thou knowest him? Son of man, that Thou esteemest him?
144.5: Jehovah, incline Thy heavens and come down, Strike against mountains, and they smoke.

144.10: Who is giving deliverance to kings, Who is freeing David His servant from the sword of evil.
144.2: My kind one, and my bulwark, My tower, and my deliverer, My shield, and in whom I have trusted, Who is subduing my people under me!
144.8: Because their mouth hath spoken vanity, And their right hand [is] a right hand of falsehood.
144.11: Free me, and deliver me From the hand of sons of a stranger, Because their mouth hath spoken vanity, And their right hand [is] a right hand of falsehood,
144.1: By David. Blessed [is] Jehovah my rock, who is teaching My hands for war, my fingers for battle.
144.9: O God, a new song I sing to Thee, On a psaltery of ten strings I sing praise to Thee.
144.14: Our oxen are carrying, there is no breach, And there is no outgoing, And there is no crying in our broad places.
144.7: Send forth Thy hand from on high, Free me, and deliver me from many waters, From the hand of sons of a stranger,
144.15: O the happiness of the people that is thus, O the happiness of the people whose God [is] Jehovah!
144.6: Send forth lightning, and scatter them, Send forth Thine arrows, and trouble them,
144.4: Man to vanity hath been like, His days [are] as a shadow passing by.
144.13: Our garners [are] full, bringing out from kind to kind, Our flocks are bringing forth thousands, Ten thousands in our out-places,

13.3: Look attentively; Answer me, O Jehovah, my God, Enlighten mine eyes, lest I sleep in death,
13.2: Till when do I set counsels in my soul? Sorrow in my heart daily? Till when is mine enemy exalted over me?
13.1: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. Till when, O Jehovah, Dost Thou forget me? -- for ever? Till when dost Thou hide Thy face from me?
13.4: Lest mine enemy say, 'I overcame him,' Mine adversaries joy when I am moved.
13.6: I do sing to Jehovah, For He hath conferred benefits upon me!
13.5: And I, in Thy kindness I have trusted, Rejoice doth my heart in Thy salvation.

23.3: My soul He refresheth, He leadeth me in paths of righteousness, For His name's sake,
23.2: In pastures of tender grass He causeth me to lie down, By quiet waters He doth lead me.
23.1: A Psalm of David. Jehovah [is] my shepherd, I do not lack,
23.4: Also -- when I walk in a valley of death-shade, I fear no evil, for Thou [art] with me, Thy rod and Thy staff -- they comfort me.
23.6: Only -- goodness and kindness pursue me, All the days of my life, And my dwelling [is] in the house of Jehovah, For a length of days!
23.5: Thou arrangest before me a table, Over-against my adversaries, Thou hast anointed with oil my head, My cup is full!

72.16: There is a handful of corn in the earth, On the top of mountains, Shake like Lebanon doth its fruit, And they flourish out of the city as the herb of the earth.
72.3: The mountains bear peace to the people, And the heights by righteousness.
72.5: They fear Thee with the sun, and before the moon, Generation -- generations.
72.18: Blessed is Jehovah God, God of Israel, He alone is doing wonders,
72.12: For he delivereth the needy who crieth, And the poor when he hath no helper,
72.10: Kings of Tarshish and of the isles send back a present. Kings of Sheba and Seba a reward bring near.
72.2: He judgeth Thy people with righteousness, And Thy poor with judgment.
72.8: And he ruleth from sea unto sea, And from the river unto the ends of earth.
72.17: His name is to the age, Before the sun is his name continued, And they bless themselves in him, All nations do pronounce him happy.
72.11: And all kings do bow themselves to him, All nations do serve him,
72.1: By Solomon. O God, Thy judgments to the king give, And Thy righteousness to the king's son.
72.9: Before him bow do the inhabitants of the dry places, And his enemies lick the dust.
72.14: From fraud and from violence he redeemeth their soul, And precious is their blood in his eyes.
72.7: Flourish in his days doth the righteous, And abundance of peace till the moon is not.
72.15: And he liveth, and giveth to him of the gold of Sheba, And prayeth for him continually, All the day he doth bless him.
72.20: The prayers of David son of Jesse have been ended.
72.6: He cometh down as rain on mown grass, As showers -- sprinkling the earth.
72.4: He judgeth the poor of the people, Giveth deliverance to the sons of the needy, And bruiseth the oppressor.
72.19: And blessed [is] the Name of His honour to the age, And the whole earth is filled [with] His honour. Amen, and amen!
72.13: He hath pity on the poor and needy, And the souls of the needy he saveth,

45.16: Instead of thy fathers are thy sons, Thou dost appoint them for princes in all the earth.
45.3: Gird Thy sword upon the thigh, O mighty, Thy glory and Thy majesty!
45.5: Thine arrows [are] sharp, -- Peoples fall under Thee -- In the heart of the enemies of the king.
45.12: And the daughter of Tyre with a present, The rich of the people do appease thy face.
45.10: Hearken, O daughter, and see, incline thine ear, And forget thy people, and thy father's house,
45.2: Thou hast been beautified above the sons of men, Grace hath been poured into thy lips, Therefore hath God blessed thee to the age.
45.8: Myrrh and aloes, cassia! all thy garments, Out of palaces of ivory Stringed instruments have made thee glad.
45.17: I make mention of Thy name in all generations, Therefore do peoples praise Thee, To the age, and for ever!
45.11: And the king doth desire thy beauty, Because he [is] thy lord -- bow thyself to him,
45.1: To the Overseer. -- 'On the Lilies.' -- By sons of Korah. -- An Instruction. -- A song of loves. My heart hath indited a good thing, I am telling my works to a king, My tongue [is] the pen of a speedy writer.
45.9: Daughters of kings [are] among thy precious ones, A queen hath stood at thy right hand, In pure gold of Ophir.
45.14: In divers colours she is brought to the king, Virgins -- after her -- her companions, Are brought to thee.
45.7: Thou hast loved righteousness and hatest wickedness, Therefore God, thy God, hath anointed thee, Oil of joy above thy companions.
45.15: They are brought with joy and gladness, They come into the palace of the king.
45.6: Thy throne, O God, [is] age-during, and for ever, A sceptre of uprightness [Is] the sceptre of Thy kingdom.
45.4: As to Thy majesty -- prosper! -- ride! Because of truth, and meekness -- righteousness, And Thy right hand showeth Thee fearful things.
45.13: All glory [is] the daughter of the king within, Of gold-embroidered work [is] her clothing.

14.7: 'Who doth give from Zion the salvation of Israel? When Jehovah doth turn back [To] a captivity of His people, Jacob doth rejoice -- Israel is glad!
14.3: The whole have turned aside, Together they have been filthy: There is not a doer of good, not even one.
14.2: Jehovah from the heavens Hath looked on the sons of men, To see if there is a wise one -- seeking God.
14.1: To the Overseer. -- By David. A fool hath said in his heart, 'God is not;' They have done corruptly, They have done abominable actions, There is not a doer of good.
14.4: Have all working iniquity not known? Those consuming my people have eaten bread, Jehovah they have not called.
14.6: The counsel of the poor ye cause to stink, Because Jehovah [is] his refuge.
14.5: There they have feared a fear, For God [is] in the generation of the righteous.

103.16: For a wind hath passed over it, and it is not, And its place doth not discern it any more.
103.3: Who is forgiving all thine iniquities, Who is healing all thy diseases,
103.5: Who is satisfying with good thy desire, Renew itself as an eagle doth thy youth.
103.21: Bless Jehovah, all ye His hosts, His ministers -- doing His pleasure.
103.18: To those keeping His covenant, And to those remembering His precepts to do them.
103.12: As the distance of east from west He hath put far from us our transgressions.
103.10: Not according to our sins hath He done to us, Nor according to our iniquities Hath He conferred benefits upon us.
103.2: Bless, O my soul, Jehovah, And forget not all His benefits,
103.22: Bless Jehovah, all ye His works, In all places of His dominion. Bless, O my soul, Jehovah!
103.8: Merciful and gracious [is] Jehovah, Slow to anger, and abundant in mercy.
103.17: And the kindness of Jehovah [Is] from age even unto age on those fearing Him, And His righteousness to sons' sons,
103.11: For, as the height of the heavens [is] above the earth, His kindness hath been mighty over those fearing Him.
103.1: By David. Bless, O my soul, Jehovah, And all my inward parts -- His Holy Name.
103.9: Not for ever doth He strive, Nor to the age doth He watch.
103.14: For He hath known our frame, Remembering that we [are] dust.
103.7: He maketh known His ways to Moses, To the sons of Israel His acts.
103.15: Mortal man! as grass [are] his days, As a flower of the field so he flourisheth;
103.20: Bless Jehovah, ye His messengers, Mighty in power -- doing His word, To hearken to the voice of His Word.
103.6: Jehovah is doing righteousness and judgments For all the oppressed.
103.4: Who is redeeming from destruction thy life, Who is crowning thee -- kindness and mercies,
103.19: Jehovah in the heavens Hath established His throne, And His kingdom over all hath ruled.
103.13: As a father hath mercy on sons, Jehovah hath mercy on those fearing Him.

87.7: Singers also as players on instruments, All my fountains [are] in Thee!
87.3: Honourable things are spoken in Thee, O city of God. Selah.
87.2: Jehovah is loving the gates of Zion Above all the tabernacles of Jacob.
87.1: By sons of Korah. -- A Psalm, a song. His foundation [is] in holy mountains.
87.4: I mention Rahab and Babel to those knowing Me, Lo, Philistia, and Tyre, with Cush! This [one] was born there.
87.6: Jehovah doth recount in the describing of the peoples, 'This [one] was born there.' Selah.
87.5: And of Zion it is said: Each one was born in her, And He, the Most High, doth establish her.

49.16: Fear not, when one maketh wealth, When the honour of his house is abundant,
49.3: My mouth speaketh wise things, And the meditations of my heart [are] things of understanding.
49.5: Why do I fear in days of evil? The iniquity of my supplanters doth compass me.
49.18: For his soul in his life he blesseth, (And they praise thee when thou dost well for thyself.)
49.12: And man in honour doth not remain, He hath been like the beasts, they have been cut off.
49.10: For he seeth wise men die, Together the foolish and brutish perish, And have left to others their wealth.
49.2: Both low and high, together rich and needy.
49.8: And precious [is] the redemption of their soul, And it hath ceased -- to the age.
49.17: For at his death he receiveth nothing, His honour goeth not down after him.
49.11: Their heart [is]: Their houses [are] to the age, Their tabernacles to all generations. They proclaimed their names over the lands.
49.1: To the Overseer. -- By sons of Korah. A Psalm. Hear this, all ye peoples, Give ear, all ye inhabitants of the world.
49.9: And still he liveth for ever, He seeth not the pit.
49.14: As sheep for Sheol they have set themselves, Death doth afflict them, And the upright rule over them in the morning, And their form [is] for consumption. Sheol [is] a dwelling for him.
49.7: A brother doth no one at all ransom, He doth not give to God his atonement.
49.15: Only, God doth ransom my soul from the hand of Sheol, For He doth receive me. Selah.
49.20: Man in honour, who understandest not, Hath been like the beasts, they have been cut off!
49.6: Those trusting on their wealth, And in the multitude of their riches, Do shew themselves foolish.
49.4: I incline to a simile mine ear, I open with a harp my riddle:
49.19: It cometh to the generation of his fathers, For ever they see not the light.
49.13: This their way [is] folly for them, And their posterity with their sayings are pleased. Selah.

116.16: Cause [it] to come, O Jehovah, for I [am] Thy servant. I [am] Thy servant, son of Thy handmaid, Thou hast opened my bonds.
116.3: Compassed me have cords of death, And straits of Sheol have found me, Distress and sorrow I find.
116.5: Gracious [is] Jehovah, and righteous, Yea, our God [is] merciful,
116.18: My vows to Jehovah let me complete, I pray you, before all His people,
116.12: What do I return to Jehovah? All His benefits [are] upon me.
116.10: I have believed, for I speak, I -- I have been afflicted greatly.
116.2: Because He hath inclined His ear to me, And during my days I call.
116.8: For Thou hast delivered my soul from death, My eyes from tears, my feet from overthrowing.
116.17: To Thee I sacrifice a sacrifice of thanks, And in the name of Jehovah I call.
116.11: I said in my haste, 'Every man [is] a liar.'
116.1: I have loved, because Jehovah heareth My voice, my supplication,
116.9: I walk habitually before Jehovah In the lands of the living.
116.14: My vows to Jehovah let me complete, I pray you, before all His people.
116.7: Turn back, O my soul, to thy rest, For Jehovah hath conferred benefits on thee.
116.15: Precious in the eyes of Jehovah [is] the death for His saints.
116.6: A preserver of the simple [is] Jehovah, I was low, and to me He giveth salvation.
116.4: And in the name of Jehovah I call: I pray Thee, O Jehovah, deliver my soul,
116.19: In the courts of the house of Jehovah, In thy midst, O Jerusalem, praise ye Jah!
116.13: The cup of salvation I lift up, And in the name of Jehovah I call.

81.16: He causeth him to eat of the fat of wheat, And [with] honey from a rock I satisfy thee!
81.3: Blow in the month a trumpet, In the new moon, at the day of our festival,
81.5: A testimony on Joseph He hath placed it, In his going forth over the land of Egypt. A lip, I have not known -- I hear.
81.12: And I send them away in the enmity of their heart, They walk in their own counsels.
81.10: I [am] Jehovah thy God, Who bringeth thee up out of the land of Egypt. Enlarge thy mouth, and I fill it.
81.2: Lift up a song, and give out a timbrel, A pleasant harp with psaltery.
81.8: Hear, O My people, and I testify to thee, O Israel, if thou dost hearken to me:
81.11: But, My people hearkened not to My voice, And Israel hath not consented to Me.
81.1: To the Overseer. -- 'On the Gittith.' By Asaph. Cry aloud to God our strength, Shout to the God of Jacob.
81.9: There is not in thee a strange god, And thou bowest not thyself to a strange god.
81.14: As a little thing their enemies I cause to bow, And against their adversaries I turn back My hand,
81.7: In distress thou hast called and I deliver thee, I answer thee in the secret place of thunder, I try thee by the waters of Meribah. Selah.
81.15: Those hating Jehovah feign obedience to Him, But their time is -- to the age.
81.6: From the burden his shoulder I turned aside, His hands from the basket pass over.
81.4: For a statute to Israel it [is], An ordinance of the God of Jacob.
81.13: O that My people were hearkening to Me, Israel in My ways would walk.

125.2: Jerusalem! mountains [are] round about her, And Jehovah [is] round about His people, From henceforth even unto the age.
125.4: Do good, O Jehovah, to the good, And to the upright in their hearts.
125.5: As to those turning [to] their crooked ways, Jehovah causeth them to go with workers of iniquity. Peace on Israel!
125.1: A Song of the Ascents. Those trusting in Jehovah [are] as Mount Zion, It is not moved -- to the age it abideth.
125.3: For the rod of wickedness resteth not On the lot of the righteous, That the righteous put not forth on iniquity their hands.

113.7: He is raising up from the dust the poor, From a dunghill He exalteth the needy.
113.9: Causing the barren one of the house to sit, A joyful mother of sons; praise ye Jah!
113.3: From the rising of the sun unto its going in, Praised [is] the name of Jehovah.
113.2: The name of Jehovah is blessed, From henceforth, and unto the age.
113.1: Praise ye Jah! Praise, ye servants of Jehovah. Praise the name of Jehovah.
113.4: High above all nations [is] Jehovah, Above the heavens [is] his honour.
113.6: He is humbling [Himself] to look On the heavens and on the earth.
113.5: Who [is] as Jehovah our God, He is exalting [Himself] to sit?
113.8: To cause to sit with princes, With the princes of His people.

3.7: Rise, O Jehovah! save me, my God. Because Thou hast smitten All mine enemies [on] the cheek. The teeth of the wicked Thou hast broken.
3.3: And Thou, O Jehovah, [art] a shield for me, My honour, and lifter up of my head.
3.2: Many are saying of my soul, 'There is no salvation for him in God.' Selah.
3.1: A Psalm of David, in his fleeing from the face of Absalom his son. Jehovah, how have my distresses multiplied! Many are rising up against me.
3.4: My voice [is] unto Jehovah: I call: And He answereth me from his holy hill, Selah.
3.6: I am not afraid of myriads of people, That round about they have set against me.
3.5: I -- I have lain down, and I sleep, I have waked, for Jehovah sustaineth me.
3.8: Of Jehovah [is] this salvation; On Thy people [is] Thy blessing! Selah.

75.7: But God [is] judge, This He maketh low -- and this He lifteth up.
75.9: And I -- I declare [it] to the age, I sing praise to the God of Jacob.
75.10: And all horns of the wicked I cut off, Exalted are the horns of the righteous!
75.3: Melted is the earth and all its inhabitants, I -- I have pondered its pillars. Selah.
75.2: When I receive an appointment, I -- I do judge uprightly.
75.1: To the Overseer. -- 'Destroy not.' -- A Psalm of Asaph. -- A Song. We have given thanks to Thee, O God, We have given thanks, and near [is] Thy name, They have recounted Thy wonders.
75.4: I have said to the boastful, 'Be not boastful,' And to the wicked, 'Raise not up a horn.'
75.6: For not from the east, or from the west, Nor from the wilderness -- [is] elevation.
75.5: Raise not up on high your horn, (Ye speak with a stiff neck.)
75.8: For a cup [is] in the hand of Jehovah, And the wine hath foamed, It is full of mixture, and He poureth out of it, Only its dregs wring out, and drink, Do all the wicked of the earth,

94.16: Who riseth up for me with evil doers? Who stationeth himself for me with workers of iniquity?
94.3: Till when [do] the wicked, O Jehovah? Till when do the wicked exult?
94.5: Thy people, O Jehovah, they bruise, And Thine inheritance they afflict.
94.21: They decree against the soul of the righteous, And innocent blood declare wicked.
94.18: If I have said, 'My foot hath slipped,' Thy kindness, O Jehovah, supporteth me.
94.12: O the happiness of the man Whom Thou instructest, O Jah, And out of Thy law teachest him,
94.10: He who is instructing nations, Doth He not reprove? He who is teaching man knowledge [is] Jehovah.
94.2: Be lifted up, O Judge of the earth, Send back a recompence on the proud.
94.22: And Jehovah is for a high place to me, And my God [is] for a rock -- my refuge,
94.8: Consider, ye brutish among the people, And ye foolish, when do ye act wisely?
94.17: Unless Jehovah [were] a help to me, My soul had almost inhabited silence.
94.11: He knoweth the thoughts of man, that they [are] vanity.
94.1: God of vengeance -- Jehovah! God of vengeance, shine forth.
94.9: He who planteth the ear doth He not hear? He who formeth the eye doth He not see?
94.14: For Jehovah leaveth not His people, And His inheritance forsaketh not.
94.7: And they say, 'Jehovah doth not see, And the God of Jacob doth not consider.'
94.15: For to righteousness judgment turneth back, And after it all the upright of heart,
94.20: Is a throne of mischief joined [with] Thee? A framer of perverseness by statute?
94.23: And turneth back on them their iniquity, And in their wickedness cutteth them off; Jehovah our God doth cut them off!
94.6: Widow and sojourner they slay, And fatherless ones they murder.
94.4: They utter -- they speak an old saw, All working iniquity do boast themselves.
94.19: In the abundance of my thoughts within me, Thy comforts delight my soul.
94.13: To give rest to him from days of evil, While a pit is digged for the wicked.

101.7: He dwelleth not in my house who is working deceit, Whoso is speaking lies Is not established before mine eyes.
101.3: I set not before mine eyes a worthless thing, The work of those turning aside I have hated, It adhereth not to me.
101.2: I act wisely in a perfect way, When dost Thou come in unto me? I walk habitually in the integrity of my heart, In the midst of my house.
101.1: A Psalm of David. Kindness and judgment I sing, To Thee, O Jehovah, I sing praise.
101.4: A perverse heart turneth aside from me, Wickedness I know not.
101.6: Mine eyes are on the faithful of the land, To dwell with me, Whoso is walking in a perfect way, he serveth me.
101.5: Whoso slandereth in secret his neighbour, Him I cut off, The high of eyes and proud of heart, him I endure not.
101.8: At morning I cut off all the wicked of the land, To cut off from the city of Jehovah All the workers of iniquity!

85.3: Thou hast gathered up all Thy wrath, Thou hast turned back from the fierceness of Thine anger.
85.5: To the age art Thou angry against us? Dost Thou draw out Thine anger To generation and generation?
85.12: Jehovah also giveth that which is good, And our land doth give its increase.
85.10: Kindness and truth have met, Righteousness and peace have kissed,
85.2: Thou hast borne away the iniquity of Thy people, Thou hast covered all their sin. Selah.
85.8: I hear what God Jehovah speaketh, For He speaketh peace unto His people, And unto His saints, and they turn not back to folly.
85.11: Truth from the earth springeth up, And righteousness from heaven looketh out,
85.1: To the Overseer. -- By sons of Korah. A Psalm. Thou hast accepted, O Jehovah, Thy land, Thou hast turned [to] the captivity of Jacob.
85.9: Only, near to those fearing Him [is] His salvation, That honour may dwell in our land.
85.7: Show us, O Jehovah, thy kindness, And Thy salvation Thou dost give to us.
85.6: Dost Thou not turn back? Thou revivest us, And Thy people do rejoice in Thee.
85.4: Turn back [to] us, O God of our salvation, And make void Thine anger with us.
85.13: Righteousness before Him goeth, And maketh His footsteps for a way!

146.7: Doing judgment for the oppressed, Giving bread to the hungry.
146.9: Jehovah is preserving the strangers, The fatherless and widow He causeth to stand, And the way of the wicked He turneth upside down.
146.10: Jehovah doth reign to the age, Thy God, O Zion, to generation and generation, Praise ye Jah!
146.3: Trust not in princes -- in a son of man, For he hath no deliverance.
146.2: I praise Jehovah during my life, I sing praise to my God while I exist.
146.1: Praise ye Jah! Praise, O my soul, Jehovah.
146.4: His spirit goeth forth, he returneth to his earth, In that day have his thoughts perished.
146.6: Making the heavens and earth, The sea and all that [is] in them, Who is keeping truth to the age,
146.5: O the happiness of him Who hath the God of Jacob for his help, His hope [is] on Jehovah his God,
146.8: Jehovah is loosing the prisoners, Jehovah is opening (the eyes of) the blind, Jehovah is raising the bowed down, Jehovah is loving the righteous,

114.7: From before the Lord be afraid, O earth, From before the God of Jacob,
114.3: The sea hath seen, and fleeth, The Jordan turneth backward.
114.2: Judah became His sanctuary, Israel his dominion.
114.1: In the going out of Israel from Egypt, The house of Jacob from a strange people,
114.4: The mountains have skipped as rams, Heights as sons of a flock.
114.6: O mountains, ye skip as rams! O heights, as sons of a flock!
114.5: What -- to thee, O sea, that thou fleest? O Jordan, thou turnest back!
114.8: He is turning the rock to a pool of waters, The flint to a fountain of waters!

21.3: For Thou puttest before him blessings of goodness, Thou settest on his head a crown of fine gold.
21.5: Great [is] his honour in Thy salvation, Honour and majesty Thou placest on him.
21.12: For Thou makest them a butt, When Thy strings Thou preparest against their faces.
21.10: Their fruit from earth Thou destroyest, And their seed from the sons of men.
21.2: The desire of his heart Thou gavest to him, And the request of his lips Thou hast not withheld. Selah.
21.8: Thy hand cometh to all Thine enemies, Thy right hand doth find Thy haters.
21.11: For they stretched out against Thee evil, They devised a wicked device, they prevail not,
21.1: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. Jehovah, in Thy strength is the king joyful, In Thy salvation how greatly he rejoiceth.
21.9: Thou makest them as a furnace of fire, At the time of Thy presence. Jehovah in His anger doth swallow them, And fire doth devour them.
21.7: For the king is trusting in Jehovah, And in the kindness of the Most High He is not moved.
21.6: For Thou makest him blessings for ever, Thou dost cause him to rejoice with joy, By Thy countenance.
21.4: Life he hath asked from Thee, Thou hast given to him -- length of days, Age-during -- and for ever.
21.13: Be Thou exalted, O Jehovah in, Thy strength, We sing and we praise Thy might!

24.7: Lift up, O gates, your heads, And be lifted up, O doors age-during, And come in doth the king of glory!
24.9: Lift up, O gates, your heads, And be lifted up, O doors age-during, And come in doth the king of glory!
24.10: Who [is] He -- this 'king of glory?' Jehovah of hosts -- He [is] the king of glory! Selah.
24.3: Who goeth up into the hill of Jehovah? And who riseth up in His holy place?
24.2: For He on the seas hath founded it, And on the floods He doth establish it.
24.1: A Psalm of David. To Jehovah [is] the earth and its fulness, The world and the inhabitants in it.
24.4: The clean of hands, and pure of heart, Who hath not lifted up to vanity his soul, Nor hath sworn to deceit.
24.6: This [is] a generation of those seeking Him. Seeking Thy face, O Jacob! Selah.
24.5: He beareth away a blessing from Jehovah, Righteousness from the God of his salvation.
24.8: Who [is] this -- 'the king of glory?' Jehovah -- strong and mighty, Jehovah, the mighty in battle.

52.7: 'Lo, the man who maketh not God his strong place, And trusteth in the abundance of his riches, He is strong in his mischiefs.'
52.9: I thank Thee to the age, because Thou hast done [it], And I wait [on] Thy name for [it is] good before Thy saints!
52.3: Thou hast loved evil rather than good, Lying, than speaking righteousness. Selah.
52.2: Mischiefs doth thy tongue devise, Like a sharp razor, working deceit.
52.1: To the Overseer. -- An instruction, by David, in the coming in of Doeg the Edomite, and he declareth to Saul, and saith to him, 'David came in unto the house of Ahimelech.' What, boasteth thou in evil, O mighty one? The kindness of God [is] all the day.
52.4: Thou hast loved all devouring words, O thou deceitful tongue.

32.7: Thou [art] a hiding-place for me, From distress Thou dost keep me, [With] songs of deliverance dost compass me. Selah.

8.7: Sheep and oxen, all of them, And also beasts of the field,

65.3: Matters of iniquities were mightier than I, Our transgressions -- Thou dost cover them.

35.11: Violent witnesses rise up, That which I have not known they ask me.

35.5: They are as chaff before wind, And a messenger of Jehovah driving away.

60.7: Mine [is] Gilead, and mine [is] Manasseh, And Ephraim [is] the strength of my head, Judah [is] my lawgiver,

O God, Thou hadst cast us off, Thou hadst broken us -- hadst been angry! -- Thou dost turn back to us.

34.16: (The face of Jehovah [is] on doers of evil, To cut off from earth their memorial.)

132.16: And her priests I clothe [with] salvation, And her pious ones do sing aloud.

104.11: They water every beast of the field, Wild asses break their thirst.

28.7: Jehovah [is] my strength, and my shield, In Him my heart trusted, and I have been helped. And my heart exulteth, And with my song I thank Him.

50.16: And to the wicked hath God said: What to thee -- to recount My statutes? That thou liftest up My covenant on thy mouth?
