10.18: To judge the fatherless and bruised: He addeth no more to oppress -- man of the earth!
10.12: Arise, O Jehovah! O God, lift up Thy hand! Forget not the humble.
10.10: He is bruised -- he boweth down, Fallen by his mighty ones hath the afflicted.
10.2: Through the pride of the wicked, Is the poor inflamed, They are caught in devices that they devised.
10.8: He doth sit in an ambush of the villages, In secret places he doth slay the innocent. His eyes for the afflicted watch secretly,
10.17: The desire of the humble Thou hast heard, O Jehovah. Thou preparest their heart; Thou causest Thine ear to attend,
10.11: He said in his heart, 'God hath forgotten, He hath hid His face, He hath never seen.'
10.1: Why, Jehovah, dost Thou stand at a distance? Thou dost hide in times of adversity,
10.9: He lieth in wait in a secret place, as a lion in a covert. He lieth in wait to catch the poor, He catcheth the poor, drawing him into his net.
10.14: Thou hast seen, For Thou perverseness and anger beholdest; By giving into Thy hand, On Thee doth the afflicted leave [it], Of the fatherless Thou hast been an helper.
10.7: Of oaths his mouth is full, And deceits, and fraud: Under his tongue [is] perverseness and iniquity,
10.15: Break the arm of the wicked and the evil, Seek out his wickedness, find none;
10.6: He hath said in his heart, 'I am not moved,' To generation and generation not in evil.
10.4: The wicked according to the height of his face, inquireth not. 'God is not!' [are] all his devices.
10.13: Wherefore hath the wicked despised God? He hath said in his heart, 'It is not required.'

9.16: Jehovah hath been known, Judgment He hath done, By a work of his hands Hath the wicked been snared. Meditation. Selah.
9.3: In mine enemies turning backward, they stumble and perish from Thy face.
9.5: Thou hast rebuked nations, Thou hast destroyed the wicked, Their name Thou hast blotted out to the age and for ever.
9.18: For not for ever is the needy forgotten, The hope of the humble lost to the age.
9.12: For He who is seeking for blood Them hath remembered, He hath not forgotten the cry of the afflicted.
9.10: They trust in Thee who do know Thy name, For Thou hast not forsaken Those seeking Thee, O Jehovah.
9.2: I rejoice and exult in Thee, I praise Thy Name, O Most High.
9.8: And He judgeth the world in righteousness, He judgeth the peoples in uprightness.
9.17: The wicked do turn back to Sheol, All nations forgetting God.
9.11: Sing ye praise to Jehovah, inhabiting Zion, Declare ye among the peoples His acts,
9.1: To the Overseer, 'On the Death of Labben.' -- A Psalm of David. I confess, O Jehovah, with all my heart, I recount all Thy wonders,
9.9: And Jehovah is a tower for the bruised, A tower for times of adversity.
9.14: So that I recount all Thy praise, In the gates of the daughter of Zion. I rejoice on Thy salvation.
9.7: And Jehovah to the age abideth, He is preparing for judgment His throne.
9.15: Sunk have nations in a pit they made, In a net that they hid hath their foot been captured.
9.20: Appoint, O Jehovah, a director to them, Let nations know they [are] men! Selah.
9.6: O thou Enemy, Finished have been destructions for ever, As to cities thou hast plucked up, Perished hath their memorial with them.
9.4: For Thou hast done my judgment and my right. Thou hast sat on a throne, A judge of righteousness.
9.19: Rise, O Jehovah, let not man be strong, Let nations be judged before Thy face.
9.13: Favour me, O Jehovah, See mine affliction by those hating me, Thou who liftest me up from the gates of death,

134.2: Lift up your hands [in] the sanctuary, And bless ye Jehovah.
134.1: A Song of the Ascents. Lo, bless Jehovah, all servants of Jehovah, Who are standing in the house of Jehovah by night.
134.3: Jehovah doth bless thee out of Zion, The maker of the heavens and earth!

57.7: Prepared is my heart, O God, Prepared is my heart, I sing and praise.
57.9: I thank Thee among the peoples, O Lord, I praise Thee among the nations.
57.10: For great unto the heavens [is] Thy kindness, And unto the clouds Thy truth.
57.3: He sendeth from the heaven, and saveth me, He reproached -- who is panting after me. Selah. God sendeth forth His kindness and His truth.
57.11: Be thou exalted above the heavens, O God. Above all the earth Thine honour!
57.2: I call to God Most High, To God [who] is perfecting for me.
57.1: To the Overseer. -- 'Destroy not.' -- A secret treasure of David, in his fleeing from the face of Saul into a cave. Favour me, O God, favour me, For in Thee is my soul trusting, And in the shadow of Thy wings I trust, Until the calamities pass over.
57.4: My soul [is] in the midst of lions, I lie down [among] flames -- sons of men, Their teeth [are] a spear and arrows, And their tongue a sharp sword.
57.6: A net they have prepared for my steps, Bowed down hath my soul, They have digged before me a pit, They have fallen into its midst. Selah.
57.5: Be Thou exalted above the heavens, O God, Above all the earth Thine honour.
57.8: Awake, mine honour, awake, psaltery and harp, I awake the morning dawn.

142.7: Bring forth from prison my soul to confess Thy name, The righteous do compass me about, When Thou conferrest benefits upon me!
142.3: When my spirit hath been feeble in me, Then Thou hast known my path; In the way [in] which I walk, They have hid a snare for me.
142.2: I pour forth before Him my meditation, My distress before Him I declare.
142.1: An Instruction of David, a Prayer when he is in the cave. My voice [is] unto Jehovah, I cry, My voice [is] unto Jehovah, I entreat grace.
142.4: Looking on the right hand -- and seeing, And I have none recognizing; Perished hath refuge from me, There is none inquiring for my soul.
142.6: Attend Thou unto my loud cry, For I have become very low, Deliver Thou me from my pursuers, For they have been stronger than I.
142.5: I have cried unto thee, O Jehovah, I have said, 'Thou [art] my refuge, My portion in the land of the living.'

64.7: And God doth shoot them [with] an arrow, Sudden have been their wounds,
64.9: And all men fear, and declare the work of God, And His deed they have considered wisely.
64.10: The righteous doth rejoice in Jehovah, And hath trusted in Him, And boast themselves do all the upright of heart!
64.3: Who sharpened as a sword their tongue, They directed their arrow -- a bitter word.
64.2: Hidest me from the secret counsel of evil doers, From the tumult of workers of iniquity.
64.1: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. Hear, O God, my voice, in my meditation, From the fear of an enemy Thou keepest my life,
64.4: To shoot in secret places the perfect, Suddenly they shoot him, and fear not.
64.6: They search out perverse things, 'We perfected a searching search,' And the inward part of man, and the heart [are] deep.
64.5: They strengthen for themselves an evil thing, They recount of the hiding of snares, They have said, 'Who doth look at it?'
64.8: And they cause him to stumble, Against them [is] their own tongue, Every looker on them fleeth away.

12.7: Thou, O Jehovah, dost preserve them, Thou keepest us from this generation to the age.
12.3: Jehovah doth cut off all lips of flattery, A tongue speaking great things,
12.2: Vanity they speak each with his neighbour, Lip of flattery! With heart and heart they speak.
12.1: To the Overseer, on the octave. -- A Psalm of David. Save, Jehovah, for the saintly hath failed, For the stedfast have ceased From the sons of men:
12.4: Who said, 'By our tongue we do mightily: Our lips [are] our own; who [is] lord over us?'
12.6: Sayings of Jehovah [are] pure sayings; Silver tried in a furnace of earth refined sevenfold.
12.5: Because of the spoiling of the poor, Because of the groaning of the needy, Now do I arise, saith Jehovah, I set in safety [him who] doth breathe for it.
12.8: Around the wicked walk continually, According as vileness is exalted by sons of men!

119.121: [Ain.] I have done judgment and righteousness, Leave me not to mine oppressors.
119.31: I have adhered to Thy testimonies, O Jehovah, put me not to shame.
119.117: Support Thou me, and I am saved, And I look on Thy statutes continually.
119.59: I have reckoned my ways, And turn back my feet unto Thy testimonies.
119.5: O that my ways were prepared to keep Thy statutes,
119.53: Horror hath seized me, Because of the wicked forsaking Thy law.
119.47: And I delight myself in Thy commands, That I have loved,
119.100: Above elders I understand more, For Thy precepts I have kept.
119.78: Ashamed are the proud, For [with] falsehood they dealt perversely with me. I meditate in Thy precepts.
119.169: [Taw.] My loud cry cometh near before Thee, O Jehovah; According to Thy word cause me to understand.
119.170: My supplication cometh in before Thee, According to Thy saying deliver Thou me.
119.89: [Lamed.] To the age, O Jehovah, Thy word is set up in the heavens.
119.108: Free-will-offerings of my mouth, Accept, I pray Thee, O Jehovah, And Thy judgments teach Thou me.
119.39: Remove my reproach that I have feared, For Thy judgments [are] good.
119.110: The wicked have laid a snare for me, And from thy precepts I wandered not.
119.51: The proud have utterly scorned me, From Thy law I have not turned aside.
119.144: The righteousness of Thy testimonies [is] to Cause me to understand, and I live!
119.13: With my lips I have recounted All the judgments of Thy mouth.
119.23: Princes also sat -- against me they spoke, Thy servant doth meditate in Thy statutes,
119.72: Better to me [is] the law of Thy mouth Than thousands of gold and silver!
119.158: I have seen treacherous ones, And grieve myself, Because Thy saying they have not kept.
119.45: And I walk habitually in a broad place, For Thy precepts I have sought.
119.14: In the way of Thy testimonies I have joyed, As over all wealth.
119.103: How sweet to my palate hath been Thy saying, Above honey to my mouth.
119.87: Almost consumed me on earth have they, And I -- I have not forsaken Thy precepts.
119.49: [Zain.] Remember the word to Thy servant, On which Thou hast caused me to hope.
119.116: Sustain me according to Thy saying, And I live, and Thou puttest me not to shame Because of my hope.
119.81: [Kaph.] Consumed for Thy salvation hath been my soul, For Thy word I have hoped.
119.125: Thy servant [am] I -- cause me to understand, And I know Thy testimonies.
119.113: [Samech.] Doubting ones I have hated, And Thy law I have loved.
119.3: Yea, they have not done iniquity, In His ways they have walked.
119.75: I have known, O Jehovah, That righteous [are] Thy judgments, And [in] faithfulness Thou hast afflicted me.
119.153: [Resh.] See my affliction, and deliver Thou me, For Thy law I have not forgotten.
119.156: Thy mercies [are] many, O Jehovah, According to Thy judgments quicken me.
119.94: I [am] Thine, save Thou me, For Thy precepts I have sought.
119.101: From every evil path I restrained my feet, So that I keep Thy word.
119.85: The proud have digged for me pits, That [are] not according to Thy law.
119.146: I have called Thee, save Thou me, And I do keep Thy testimonies.
119.114: My hiding place and my shield [art] Thou, For Thy word I have hoped.
119.21: Thou hast rebuked the cursed proud, Who are erring from Thy commands.
119.24: Thy testimonies also [are] my delight, The men of my counsel!
119.52: I remembered Thy judgments of old, O Jehovah, And I comfort myself.
119.163: Falsehood I have hated, yea I abominate [it], Thy law I have loved.
119.43: And Thou takest not utterly away From my mouth the word of truth, Because for Thy judgment I have hoped.
119.145: [Koph.] I have called with the whole heart, Answer me, O Jehovah, Thy statutes I keep,
119.154: Plead my plea, and redeem me, According to Thy saying quicken me.
119.173: Thy hand is for a help to me, For Thy commands I have chosen.
119.168: I have kept Thy precepts and Thy testimonies, For all my ways are before Thee!
119.32: The way of Thy commands I run, For Thou dost enlarge my heart!
119.20: Broken hath my soul for desire Unto Thy judgments at all times.
119.73: [Yod.] Thy hands made me and establish me, Cause me to understand, and I learn Thy commands.
119.133: My steps establish by Thy saying, And any iniquity doth not rule over me.
119.8: Thy statutes I keep, leave me not utterly!
119.29: The way of falsehood turn aside from me And with Thy law favour me.
119.2: O the happiness of those keeping His testimonies, With the whole heart they seek Him.
119.62: At midnight I rise to give thanks to Thee, For the judgments of Thy righteousness.
119.33: [He.] Show me, O Jehovah, the way of Thy statutes, And I keep it -- [to] the end.
119.175: My soul liveth, and it doth praise Thee, And Thy judgments do help me.
119.84: How many [are] the days of Thy servant? When dost Thou execute Against my pursuers judgment?
119.107: I have been afflicted very much, O Jehovah, quicken me, according to Thy word.
119.58: I appeased Thy face with the whole heart, Favour me according to Thy saying.
119.139: Cut me off hath my zeal, For mine adversaries forgot Thy words.
119.112: I have inclined my heart To do Thy statutes, to the age -- [to] the end!
119.48: And I lift up my hands unto Thy commands, That I have loved, And I do meditate on Thy statutes!
119.42: And I answer him who is reproaching me a word, For I have trusted in Thy word.
119.130: The opening of Thy words enlighteneth, Instructing the simple.
119.65: [Teth.] Good Thou didst with Thy servant, O Jehovah, According to Thy word.
119.157: Many [are] my pursuers, and adversaries, From Thy testimonies I have not turned aside.
119.35: Cause me to tread in the path of Thy commands, For in it I have delighted.
119.172: My tongue doth sing of Thy saying, For all Thy commands [are] righteous.
119.60: I have made haste, And delayed not, to keep Thy commands.
119.152: Of old I have known Thy testimonies, That to the age Thou hast founded them!
119.115: Turn aside from me, ye evil-doers, And I keep the commands of my God.
119.34: Cause me to understand, and I keep Thy law, And observe it with the whole heart.
119.132: Look unto me, and favour me, As customary to those loving Thy name.
119.104: From Thy precepts I have understanding, Therefore I have hated every false path!
119.162: I do rejoice concerning Thy saying, As one finding abundant spoil.
119.28: My soul hath dropped from affliction, Establish me according to Thy word.
119.76: Let, I pray Thee, Thy kindness be to comfort me, According to Thy saying to Thy servant.
119.166: I have waited for Thy salvation, O Jehovah, And Thy commands I have done.
119.167: Kept hath my soul Thy testimonies, And I do love them exceedingly.
119.155: Far from the wicked [is] salvation, For Thy statutes they have not sought.
119.50: This [is] my comfort in mine affliction, That Thy saying hath quickened me.
119.106: I have sworn, and I confirm [it], To keep the judgments of Thy righteousness.
119.80: My heart is perfect in Thy statutes, So that I am not ashamed.
119.19: A sojourner I [am] on earth, Hide not from me Thy commands.
119.10: With all my heart I have sought Thee, Let me not err from Thy commands.
119.9: [Beth.] With what doth a young man purify his path? To observe -- according to Thy word.
119.134: Ransom me from the oppression of man, And I observe Thy precepts,
119.57: [Cheth.] My portion [is] Jehovah; I have said -- to keep Thy words,
119.142: Thy righteousness [is] righteousness to the age, And Thy law [is] truth.
119.64: Of Thy kindness, O Jehovah, the earth is full, Thy statutes teach Thou me!
119.165: Abundant peace have those loving Thy law, And they have no stumbling-block.
119.12: Blessed [art] Thou, O Jehovah, teach me Thy statutes.
119.119: Dross! Thou hast caused to cease All the wicked of the earth; Therefore I have loved Thy testimonies.
119.99: Above all my teachers I have acted wisely. For Thy testimonies [are] my meditation.
119.129: [Pe.] Wonderful [are] Thy testimonies, Therefore hath my soul kept them.
119.127: Therefore I have loved Thy commands Above gold -- even fine gold.
119.93: To the age I forget not Thy precepts, For by them Thou hast quickened me.
119.1: [Aleph.] O the happiness of those perfect in the way, They are walking in the law of Jehovah,
119.122: Make sure Thy servant for good, Let not the proud oppress me.
119.66: The goodness of reason and knowledge teach me, For in Thy commands I have believed.
119.82: Consumed have been mine eyes for Thy word, Saying, 'When doth it comfort me?'
119.126: Time for Jehovah to work! they have made void Thy law.
119.41: [Waw.] And meet me doth Thy kindness, O Jehovah, Thy salvation according to Thy saying.
119.37: Remove mine eyes from seeing vanity, In Thy way quicken Thou me.
119.111: I have inherited Thy testimonies to the age, For the joy of my heart [are] they.
119.123: Mine eyes have been consumed for Thy salvation. And for the saying of Thy righteousness.
119.91: According to Thine ordinances They have stood this day, for the whole [are] Thy servants.
119.79: Those fearing Thee turn back to me, And those knowing Thy testimonies.
119.68: Good Thou [art], and doing good, Teach me Thy statutes.
119.143: Adversity and distress have found me, Thy commands [are] my delights.
119.171: My lips do utter praise, For Thou dost teach me Thy statutes.
119.92: Unless Thy law [were] my delights, Then had I perished in mine affliction.
119.118: Thou hast trodden down All going astray from Thy statutes, For falsehood [is] their deceit.
119.18: Uncover mine eyes, and I behold wonders out of Thy law.
119.90: To all generations Thy faithfulness, Thou didst establish earth, and it standeth.
119.161: [Shin.] Princes have pursued me without cause, And because of Thy words was my heart afraid.
119.135: Thy face cause to shine on Thy servant, And teach me Thy statutes.
119.56: This hath been to me, That Thy precepts I have kept!
119.150: Near have been my wicked pursuers, From Thy law they have been far off.
119.83: For I have been as a bottle in smoke, Thy statutes I have not forgotten.
119.141: Small I [am], and despised, Thy precepts I have not forgotten.
119.71: Good for me that I have been afflicted, That I might learn Thy statutes.
119.164: Seven [times] in a day I have praised Thee, Because of the judgments of Thy righteousness.
119.11: In my heart I have hid Thy saying, That I sin not before Thee.
119.105: [Nun.] A lamp to my foot [is] Thy word, And a light to my path.
119.16: In Thy statutes I delight myself, I do not forget Thy word.
119.77: Meet me do Thy mercies, and I live, For Thy law [is] my delight.
119.25: [Daleth.] Cleaved to the dust hath my soul, Quicken me according to Thy word.
119.137: [Tzade.] Righteous [art] Thou, O Jehovah, And upright [are] Thy judgments.
119.54: Songs have been to me Thy statutes, In the house of my sojournings.
119.6: Then I am not ashamed In my looking unto all Thy commands.
119.67: Before I am afflicted, I -- I am erring, And now Thy saying I have kept.
119.40: Lo, I have longed for Thy precepts, In Thy righteousness quicken Thou me,
119.149: My voice hear, according to Thy kindness, Jehovah, according to Thy judgment quicken me.
119.27: The way of Thy precepts cause me to understand, And I meditate in Thy wonders.
119.30: The way of faithfulness I have chosen, Thy judgments I have compared,
119.96: Of all perfection I have seen an end, Broad [is] Thy command -- exceedingly!
119.128: Therefore all my appointments I have declared wholly right, Every path of falsehood I have hated!
119.97: [Mem.] O how I have loved Thy law! All the day it [is] my meditation.
119.4: Thou hast commanded us Thy precepts to keep diligently,
119.46: And I speak of Thy testimonies before kings, And I am not ashamed.
119.120: Trembled from Thy fear hath my flesh, And from Thy judgments I have been afraid!
119.74: Those fearing Thee see me and rejoice, Because for Thy word I have hoped.
119.147: I have gone forward in the dawn, and I cry, For Thy word I have hoped.
119.98: Than mine enemies Thy command maketh me wiser, For it [is] before me to the age.
119.70: Insensate as fat hath been their heart, I -- in Thy law I have delighted.
119.174: I have longed for Thy salvation, O Jehovah, And Thy law [is] my delight.
119.17: [Gimel.] Confer benefits on Thy servant, I live, and I keep Thy word.
119.69: Forged against me falsehood have the proud, I with the whole heart keep Thy precepts.
119.88: According to Thy kindness quicken Thou me, And I keep the testimony of Thy mouth!
119.102: From Thy judgments I turned not aside, For Thou -- Thou hast directed me.
119.136: Rivulets of waters have come down mine eyes, Because they have not kept Thy law!
119.55: I have remembered in the night Thy name, O Jehovah, And I do keep Thy law.
119.131: My mouth I have opened, yea, I pant, For, for Thy commands I have longed.
119.22: Remove from me reproach and contempt, For Thy testimonies I have kept.
119.44: And I keep Thy law continually, To the age and for ever.
119.109: My soul [is] in my hand continually, And Thy law I have not forgotten.
119.151: Near [art] Thou, O Jehovah, And all Thy commands [are] truth.
119.61: Cords of the wicked have surrounded me, Thy law I have not forgotten.
119.176: I wandered as a lost sheep, seek Thy servant, For Thy precepts I have not forgotten!
119.15: In Thy precepts I meditate, And I behold attentively Thy paths.
119.140: Tried [is] thy saying exceedingly, And Thy servant hath loved it.
119.86: All Thy commands [are] faithfulness, [With] falsehood they have pursued me, Help Thou me.
119.26: My ways I have recounted, And Thou answerest me, teach me Thy statutes,
119.138: Thou hast appointed Thy testimonies, Righteous and exceeding faithful,
119.36: Incline my heart unto Thy testimonies, And not unto dishonest gain.
119.38: Establish to Thy servant Thy saying, That [is] concerning Thy fear.
119.160: The sum of Thy word [is] truth, And to the age [is] every judgment of Thy righteousness!
119.7: I confess Thee with uprightness of heart, In my learning the judgments of Thy righteousness.
119.63: A companion I [am] to all who fear Thee, And to those keeping Thy precepts.
119.124: Do with Thy servant according to Thy kindness. And Thy statutes teach Thou me.
119.148: Mine eyes have gone before the watches, To meditate in Thy saying.
119.159: See, for thy precepts I have loved, Jehovah, According to Thy kindness quicken me.
119.95: Thy wicked waited for me to destroy me, Thy testimonies I understand.

99.7: In a pillar of cloud He speaketh unto them, They have kept His testimonies, And the statute He hath given to them.
99.9: Exalt ye Jehovah our God, And bow yourselves at His holy hill, For holy [is] Jehovah our God!
99.3: They praise Thy name, 'Great, and fearful, holy [it] is.'
99.2: Jehovah in Zion [is] great, And high He [is] over all the peoples.
99.1: Jehovah hath reigned, peoples tremble, The Inhabitant of the cherubs, the earth shaketh.
99.4: And the strength of the king Hath loved judgment, Thou -- Thou hast established uprightness; Judgment and righteousness in Jacob, Thou -- Thou hast done.
99.6: Moses and Aaron among His priests, And Samuel among those proclaiming His name. They are calling unto Jehovah, And He doth answer them.
99.5: Exalt ye Jehovah our God, And bow yourselves at His footstool, holy [is] He.
99.8: O Jehovah, our God, Thou hast afflicted them, A God forgiving Thou hast been to them, And taking vengeance on their actions.

129.7: That hath not filled the hand of a reaper, And the bosom of a binder of sheaves.
129.3: Over my back have ploughers ploughed, They have made long their furrows.
129.2: Often they distressed me from my youth, Yet they have not prevailed over me.
129.1: A Song of the Ascents. Often they distressed me from my youth, Pray, let Israel say:
129.4: Jehovah [is] righteous, He hath cut asunder cords of the wicked.
129.6: They are as grass of the roofs, That before it was drawn out withereth,
129.5: Confounded and turn backward do all hating Zion.
129.8: And the passers by have not said, 'The blessing of Jehovah [is] on you, We blessed you in the Name of Jehovah!'

127.2: Vain for you who are rising early, Who delay sitting, eating the bread of griefs, So He giveth to His beloved one sleep.
127.4: As arrows in the hand of a mighty one, So [are] the sons of the young men.
127.5: O the happiness of the man Who hath filled his quiver with them, They are not ashamed, For they speak with enemies in the gate!
127.1: A Song of the Ascents, by Solomon. If Jehovah doth not build the house, In vain have its builders laboured at it, If Jehovah doth not watch a city, In vain hath a watchman waked.
127.3: Lo, an inheritance of Jehovah [are] sons, A reward [is] the fruit of the womb.

93.2: Established is Thy throne since then, From the age Thou [art].
93.4: Than the voices of many mighty waters, Breakers of a sea, mighty on high [is] Jehovah,
93.5: Thy testimonies have been very stedfast, To Thy house comely [is] holiness, O Jehovah, for length of days!
93.1: Jehovah hath reigned, Excellency He hath put on, Jehovah put on strength, He girded Himself, Also -- established is the world, unmoved.
93.3: Floods have lifted up, O Jehovah, Floods have lifted up their voice, Floods lift up their breakers.

1.3: And he hath been as a tree, Planted by rivulets of water, That giveth its fruit in its season, And its leaf doth not wither, And all that he doth he causeth to prosper.
1.2: But -- in the law of Jehovah [is] his delight, And in His law he doth meditate by day and by night:
1.1: O the happiness of that one, who Hath not walked in the counsel of the wicked. And in the way of sinners hath not stood, And in the seat of scorners hath not sat;
1.4: Not so the wicked: But -- as chaff that wind driveth away!
1.6: For Jehovah is knowing the way of the righteous, And the way of the wicked is lost!
1.5: Therefore the wicked rise not in judgment, Nor sinners in the company of the righteous,

122.7: Peace is in thy bulwark, rest in thy high places,
122.9: For the sake of the house of Jehovah our God, I seek good for thee!
122.3: Jerusalem -- the builded one -- [Is] as a city that is joined to itself together.
122.2: Our feet have been standing in thy gates, O Jerusalem!
122.1: A Song of the Ascents, by David. I have rejoiced in those saying to me, 'To the house of Jehovah we go.'
122.4: For thither have tribes gone up, Tribes of Jah, companies of Israel, To give thanks to the name of Jehovah.
122.6: Ask ye the peace of Jerusalem, At rest are those loving thee.
122.5: For there have sat thrones of judgment, Thrones of the house of David.
122.8: For the sake of my brethren and my companions, Let me speak, I pray thee, 'Peace [be] in thee.'

66.16: Come, hear, all ye who fear God, And I recount what he did for my soul.
66.3: Say to God, 'How fearful [are] Thy works, By the abundance of Thy strength, Thine enemies feign obedience to Thee.
66.5: Come ye, and see the works of God, Fearful acts toward the sons of men.

82.7: But as man ye die, and as one of the heads ye fall,

37.11: And the humble do possess the land, And they have delighted themselves In the abundance of peace.

37.5: Roll on Jehovah thy way, And trust upon Him, and He worketh,

91.16: With length of days I satisfy him, And I cause him to look on My salvation!

79.3: They have shed their blood As water round about Jerusalem, And there is none burying.

68.11: The Lord doth give the saying, The female proclaimers [are] a numerous host.

143.7: Haste, answer me, O Jehovah, My spirit hath been consumed, Hide not Thou Thy face from me, Or I have been compared with those going down [to] the pit.

118.11: They have compassed me about, Yea, they have compassed me about, In the name of Jehovah I surely cut them off.

18.11: He maketh darkness His secret place, Round about Him His tabernacle, Darkness of waters, thick clouds of the skies.

56.3: The day I am afraid I am confident toward Thee.

27.8: To Thee said my heart 'They sought my face, Thy face, O Jehovah, I seek.'
27.11: Shew me, O Jehovah, Thy way, And lead me in a path of uprightness, For the sake of my beholders.
27.1: By David. Jehovah [is] my light and my salvation, Whom do I fear? Jehovah [is] the strength of my life, Of whom am I afraid?
27.9: Hide not Thy face from me, Turn not aside in anger Thy servant, My help Thou hast been. Leave me not, nor forsake me, O God of my salvation.
27.14: Look unto Jehovah -- be strong, And He doth strengthen thy heart, Yea, look unto Jehovah!
27.7: Hear, O Jehovah, my voice -- I call, And favour me, and answer me.
27.6: And now, lifted up is my head, Above my enemies -- my surrounders, And I sacrifice in His tent sacrifices of shouting, I sing, yea, I sing praise to Jehovah.
27.4: One [thing] I asked of Jehovah -- it I seek. My dwelling in the house of Jehovah, All the days of my life, To look on the pleasantness of Jehovah, And to inquire in His temple.
27.13: I had not believed to look on the goodness of Jehovah In the land of the living!

30.7: O Jehovah, in Thy good pleasure, Thou hast caused strength to remain for my mountain,' Thou hast hidden Thy face -- I have been troubled.
30.9: 'What gain [is] in my blood? In my going down unto corruption? Doth dust thank Thee? doth it declare Thy truth?
30.10: Hear, O Jehovah, and favour me, O Jehovah, be a helper to me.'
30.3: Jehovah, Thou hast brought up from Sheol my soul, Thou hast kept me alive, From going down [to] the pit.
30.11: Thou hast turned my mourning to dancing for me, Thou hast loosed my sackcloth, And girdest me [with] joy.
30.2: Jehovah my God, I have cried to Thee, And Thou dost heal me.
30.1: A Psalm. -- A song of the dedication of the house of David. I exalt Thee, O Jehovah, For Thou hast drawn me up, and hast not let mine enemies rejoice over me.
30.12: So that honour doth praise Thee, and is not silent, O Jehovah, my God, to the age I thank Thee!
30.4: Sing praise to Jehovah, ye His saints, And give thanks at the remembrance of His holiness,
30.6: And I -- I have said in mine ease, 'I am not moved -- to the age.
30.5: For -- a moment [is] in His anger, Life [is] in His good-will, At even remaineth weeping, and at morn singing.
30.8: Unto Thee, O Jehovah, I call, And unto Jehovah I make supplication.

96.3: Declare among nations His honour, Among all the peoples His wonders.

96.10: Say among nations, 'Jehovah hath reigned, Also -- established is the world, unmoved, He judgeth the peoples in uprightness.'

96.1: Sing to Jehovah a new song, Sing to Jehovah all the earth.

128.3: Thy wife [is] as a fruitful vine in the sides of thy house, Thy sons as olive plants around thy table.
128.2: The labour of thy hands thou surely eatest, Happy [art] thou, and good [is] to thee.
128.1: A Song of the Ascents. O the happiness of every one fearing Jehovah, Who is walking in His ways.
128.4: Lo, surely thus is the man blessed who is fearing Jehovah.

128.5: Jehovah doth bless thee out of Zion, Look, then, on the good of Jerusalem, All the days of thy life,

97.7: Ashamed are all servants of a graven image, Those boasting themselves in idols, Bow yourselves to him, all ye gods.
97.9: For Thou, Jehovah, [art] Most High over all the earth, Greatly Thou hast been exalted over all gods.
97.10: Ye who love Jehovah, hate evil, He is keeping the souls of His saints, From the hand of the wicked he delivereth them.
97.3: Fire before Him goeth, And burneth round about His adversaries.
97.11: Light [is] sown for the righteous, And for the upright of heart -- joy.
97.2: Cloud and darkness [are] round about Him, Righteousness and judgment the basis of His throne.
97.1: Jehovah hath reigned, The earth is joyful, many isles rejoice.
97.12: Rejoice, ye righteous, in Jehovah, And give thanks at the remembrance of his holiness!
97.4: Lightened have His lightnings the world, The earth hath seen, and is pained.
97.6: The heavens declared His righteousness, And all the peoples have seen His honour.
97.5: Hills, like wax, melted before Jehovah, Before the Lord of all the earth.
97.8: Zion hath heard and rejoiceth, And daughters of Judah are joyful, Because of Thy judgments, O Jehovah.

4.7: Thou hast given joy in my heart, From the time their corn and their wine Have been multiplied.
4.3: And know ye that Jehovah Hath separated a saintly one to Himself. Jehovah heareth in my calling to Him.
4.2: Sons of men! till when [is] my glory for shame? Ye love a vain thing, ye seek a lie. Selah.
4.1: To the Overseer with Stringed Instruments. -- A Psalm of David. In my calling answer Thou me, O God of my righteousness. In adversity Thou gavest enlargement to me; Favour me, and hear my prayer.
4.4: 'Tremble ye, and do not sin;' Say ye [thus] in your heart on your bed, And be ye silent. Selah.
4.6: Many are saying, 'Who doth show us good?' Lift on us the light of Thy face, O Jehovah,
4.5: Sacrifice ye sacrifices of righteousness, And trust ye unto Jehovah.
4.8: In peace together I lie down and sleep, For Thou, O Jehovah, alone, In confidence dost cause me to dwell!

46.7: Jehovah of Hosts [is] with us, A tower for us [is] the God of Jacob. Selah.
46.9: Causing wars to cease, Unto the end of the earth, the bow he shivereth, And the spear He hath cut asunder, Chariots he doth burn with fire.
46.10: Desist, and know that I [am] God, I am exalted among nations, I am exalted in the earth.
46.3: Roar -- troubled are its waters, Mountains they shake in its pride. Selah.
46.11: Jehovah of hosts [is] with us, A tower for us [is] the God of Jacob! Selah.
46.2: Therefore we fear not in the changing of earth, And in the slipping of mountains Into the heart of the seas.
46.1: To the Overseer. -- By sons of Korah. 'For the Virgins.' -- A song. God [is] to us a refuge and strength, A help in adversities found most surely.
46.4: A river -- its rivulets rejoice the city of God, Thy holy place of the tabernacles of the Most High.
46.6: Troubled have been nations, Moved have been kingdoms, He hath given forth with His voice, earth melteth.
46.5: God [is] in her midst -- she is not moved, God doth help her at the turn of the morn!
46.8: Come ye, see the works of Jehovah, Who hath done astonishing things in the earth,

120.7: I [am] peace, and when I speak they [are] for war!
120.3: What doth He give to thee? And what doth He add to thee? O deceitful tongue!
120.2: O Jehovah, deliver my soul from a lying lip, From a deceitful tongue!
120.1: A Song of the Ascents. Unto Jehovah in my distress I have called, And He answereth me.
120.4: Sharp arrows of a mighty one, with broom-coals.

120.5: Woe to me, for I have inhabited Mesech, I have dwelt with tents of Kedar.

74.16: Thine [is] the day, also Thine [is] the night, Thou hast prepared a light giver -- the sun.

74.21: Let not the oppressed turn back ashamed, Let the poor and needy praise Thy name,
74.18: Remember this -- an enemy reproached Jehovah, And a foolish people have despised Thy name.
74.12: And God [is] my king of old, Working salvation in the midst of the earth.
74.10: Till when, O God, doth an adversary reproach? Doth an enemy despise thy name for ever?
74.2: Remember Thy company. Thou didst purchase of old, Thou didst redeem the rod of Thy inheritance, This mount Zion -- Thou didst dwell in it.
74.22: Arise, O God, plead Thy plea, Remember Thy reproach from a fool all the day.

74.1: An Instruction of Asaph. Why, O God, hast Thou cast off for ever? Thine anger smoketh against the flock of Thy pasture.
74.9: Our ensigns we have not seen, There is no more a prophet, Nor with us is one knowing how long.
74.14: Thou hast broken the heads of leviathan, Thou makest him food, For the people of the dry places.

74.15: Thou hast cleaved a fountain and a stream, Thou hast dried up perennial flowings.

74.23: Forget not the voice of Thine adversaries, The noise of Thy withstanders is going up continually!

74.4: Roared have thine adversaries, In the midst of Thy meeting-places, They have set their ensigns as ensigns.
74.19: Give not up to a company, The soul of Thy turtle-dove, The company of Thy poor ones forget not for ever.
74.13: Thou hast broken by Thy strength a sea -[monster], Thou hast shivered Heads of dragons by the waters,

147.16: Who is giving snow like wool, Hoar-frost as ashes He scattereth.

147.1: Praise ye Jah! For [it is] good to praise our God, For pleasant -- comely [is] praise.

98.7: Roar doth the sea and its fulness, The world and the inhabitants in it.

70.2: Let them be ashamed and confounded Who are seeking my soul, Let them be turned backward and blush Who are desiring my evil.

17.3: Thou hast proved my heart, Thou hast inspected by night, Thou hast tried me, Thou findest nothing; My thoughts pass not over my mouth.

17.2: From before thee my judgment doth go out; Thine eyes do see uprightly.

17.9: From the face of the wicked who spoiled me. Mine enemies in soul go round against me.

17.15: I -- in righteousness, I see Thy face; I am satisfied, in awaking, [with] Thy form!

69.11: And I make my clothing sackcloth, And I am to them for a simile.
69.3: I have been wearied with my calling, Burnt hath been my throat, Consumed have been mine eyes, waiting for my God.
69.20: Reproach hath broken my heart, and I am sick, And I look for a bemoaner, and there is none, And for comforters, and I have found none.
69.12: Those sitting at the gate meditate concerning me, And those drinking strong drink, Play on instruments.
69.10: And I weep in the fasting of my soul, And it is for a reproach to me.
69.17: And hide not Thy face from Thy servant, For I am in distress -- haste, answer me.
69.13: And I -- my prayer [is] to Thee, O Jehovah, A time of good pleasure, O God, In the abundance of Thy kindness, Answer me in the truth of Thy salvation.
69.27: Give punishment for their iniquity, And they enter not into Thy righteousness.
69.30: I praise the name of God with a song, And I magnify Him with thanksgiving,
69.18: Be near unto my soul -- redeem it, Because of mine enemies ransom me.
69.36: And the seed of His servants inherit it, And those loving His name dwell in it!
69.29: And I [am] afflicted and pained, Thy salvation, O God, doth set me on high.
69.23: Darkened are their eyes from seeing, And their loins continually shake Thou.

69.1: To the Overseer. -- 'On the Lilies,' by David. Save me, O God, for come have waters unto the soul.
69.5: O God, Thou -- Thou hast known Concerning my overturn, And my desolations from Thee have not been hid.
69.4: Those hating me without cause Have been more than the hairs of my head, Mighty have been my destroyers, My lying enemies, That which I took not away -- I bring back.
69.8: A stranger I have been to my brother, And a foreigner to sons of my mother.
69.26: For they have pursued him Thou hast smitten, And recount of the pain of Thy pierced ones.
69.14: Deliver me from the mire, and let me not sink, Let me be delivered from those hating me, And from deep places of waters.
69.22: Their table before them is for a snare, And for a recompence -- for a trap.
69.28: They are blotted out of the book of life, And with the righteous are not written.
69.25: Their tower is desolated, In their tents there is no dweller.
69.9: For zeal for Thy house hath consumed me, And the reproaches of Thy reproachers Have fallen upon me.
69.33: For Jehovah hearkeneth unto the needy, And His bound ones He hath not despised.
69.15: Let not a flood of waters overflow me, Nor let the deep swallow me up, Nor let the pit shut her mouth upon me.
69.34: The heavens and earth do praise Him, Seas, and every moving thing in them.
69.21: And they give for my food gall, And for my thirst cause me to drink vinegar.
69.24: Pour upon them Thine indignation, And the fierceness of Thine anger doth seize them.
69.16: Answer me, O Jehovah, for good [is] Thy kindness, According to the abundance Of Thy mercies turn Thou unto me,
69.35: For God doth save Zion, And doth build the cities of Judah, And they have dwelt there, and possess it.
69.32: The humble have seen -- they rejoice, Ye who seek God -- and your heart liveth.
69.7: For because of Thee I have borne reproach, Shame hath covered my face.
69.2: I have sunk in deep mire, And there is no standing, I have come into the depths of the waters, And a flood hath overflown me.
69.6: Let not those waiting on Thee be ashamed because of me, O Lord, Jehovah of Hosts, Let not those seeking Thee Blush because of me, O God of Israel.
69.31: And it is better to Jehovah than an ox, A bullock -- horned -- hoofed.

88.16: Over me hath Thy wrath passed, Thy terrors have cut me off,
88.3: For my soul hath been full of evils, And my life hath come to Sheol.
88.5: Among the dead -- free, As pierced ones lying in the grave, Whom Thou hast not remembered any more, Yea, they by Thy hand have been cut off.
88.18: Thou hast put far from me lover and friend, Mine acquaintance [is] the place of darkness!
88.12: Are Thy wonders known in the darkness? And Thy righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
88.10: To the dead dost Thou do wonders? Do Rephaim rise? do they thank Thee? Selah.
88.2: My prayer cometh in before Thee, Incline Thine ear to my loud cry,
88.8: Thou hast put mine acquaintance far from me, Thou hast made me an abomination to them, Shut up -- I go not forth.

88.11: Is Thy kindness recounted in the grave? Thy faithfulness in destruction?
88.1: A Song, a Psalm, by sons of Korah, to the Overseer, 'Concerning the Sickness of Afflictions.' -- An instruction, by Heman the Ezrahite. O Jehovah, God of my salvation, Daily I have cried, nightly before Thee,
88.9: Mine eye hath grieved because of affliction, I called Thee, O Jehovah, all the day, I have spread out unto Thee my hands.
88.14: Why, O Jehovah, castest Thou off my soul? Thou hidest Thy face from me.
88.7: Upon me hath Thy fury lain, And [with] all Thy breakers Thou hast afflicted. Selah.
88.15: I [am] afflicted, and expiring from youth, I have borne Thy terrors -- I pine away.
88.6: Thou hast put me in the lowest pit, In dark places, in depths.
88.4: I have been reckoned with those going down [to] the pit, I have been as a man without strength.
88.13: And I, unto Thee, O Jehovah, I have cried, And in the morning doth my prayer come before Thee.

102.11: My days as a shadow [are] stretched out, And I -- as the herb I am withered.

102.5: From the voice of my sighing Hath my bone cleaved to my flesh.

136.16: To Him leading His people in a wilderness, For to the age [is] His kindness.

55.16: I -- to God I call, and Jehovah saveth me.

55.5: Fear and trembling come in to me, And horror doth cover me.

55.1: To the Overseer with stringed instruments. -- An instruction, by David. Give ear, O God, [to] my prayer, And hide not from my supplication.
55.9: Swallow up, O Lord, divide their tongue, For I saw violence and strife in a city.
55.14: When together we sweeten counsel, Into the house of God we walk in company.
55.7: Lo, I move far off, I lodge in a wilderness. Selah.
55.15: Desolations [are] upon them, They go down [to] Sheol -- alive, For wickedness [is] in their dwelling, in their midst.
55.20: He hath sent forth his hands against his well-wishers, He hath polluted his covenant.
55.23: And Thou, O God, dost bring them down To a pit of destruction, Men of blood and deceit reach not to half their days, And I -- I do trust in Thee!
55.6: And I say, 'Who doth give to me a pinion as a dove? I fly away and rest,
55.4: My heart is pained within me, And terrors of death have fallen on me.
55.19: God doth hear and afflict them, And He sitteth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, and fear not God,
55.13: But thou, a man -- as mine equal, My familiar friend, and mine acquaintance.

131.2: Have I not compared, and kept silent my soul, As a weaned one by its mother? As a weaned one by me [is] my soul.
131.1: A Song of the Ascents, by David. Jehovah, my heart hath not been haughty, Nor have mine eyes been high, Nor have I walked in great things, And in things too wonderful for me.
131.3: Israel doth wait on Jehovah, From henceforth, and unto the age!

22.11: Be not far from me, For adversity is near, for there is no helper.
22.3: And Thou [art] holy, Sitting -- the Praise of Israel.
22.20: Deliver from the sword my soul, From the paw of a dog mine only one.
22.12: Many bulls have surrounded me, Mighty ones of Bashan have compassed me,
22.10: On Thee I have been cast from the womb, From the belly of my mother Thou [art] my God.
22.17: I count all my bones -- they look expectingly, They look upon me,
22.13: They have opened against me their mouth, A lion tearing and roaring.
22.27: Remember and return unto Jehovah, Do all ends of the earth, And before Thee bow themselves, Do all families of the nations,
22.30: A seed doth serve Him, It is declared of the Lord to the generation.
22.18: They apportion my garments to themselves, And for my clothing they cause a lot to fall.
22.29: And the fat ones of earth have eaten, And they bow themselves, Before Him bow do all going down to dust, And he [who] hath not revived his soul.
22.23: Ye who fear Jehovah, praise ye Him, All the seed of Jacob, honour ye Him, And be afraid of Him, all ye seed of Israel.
22.19: And Thou, O Jehovah, be not far off, O my strength, to help me haste.
22.1: To the Overseer, on 'The Hind of the Morning.' -- A Psalm of David. My God, my God, why hast Thou forsaken me? Far from my salvation, The words of my roaring?
22.5: Unto Thee they cried, and were delivered, In Thee they trusted, and were not ashamed.
22.4: In Thee did our fathers trust -- they trusted, And Thou dost deliver them.
22.8: 'Roll unto Jehovah, He doth deliver him, He doth deliver him, for he delighted in him.'
22.26: The humble do eat and are satisfied, Praise Jehovah do those seeking Him, Your heart doth live for ever.
22.14: As waters I have been poured out, And separated themselves have all my bones, My heart hath been like wax, It is melted in the midst of my bowels.
22.22: I declare Thy name to my brethren, In the midst of the assembly I praise Thee.
22.28: For to Jehovah [is] the kingdom, And He is ruling among nations.
22.25: Of Thee my praise [is] in the great assembly. My vows I complete before His fearers.
22.9: For thou [art] He bringing me forth from the womb, Causing me to trust, On the breasts of my mother.
22.15: Dried up as an earthen vessel is my power, And my tongue is cleaving to my jaws.
22.21: Save me from the mouth of a lion: -- And -- from the horns of the high places Thou hast answered me!
22.24: For He hath not despised, nor abominated, The affliction of the afflicted, Nor hath He hidden His face from him, And in his crying unto Him He heareth.
22.16: And to the dust of death thou appointest me, For surrounded me have dogs, A company of evil doers have compassed me, Piercing my hands and my feet.
22.7: All beholding me do mock at me, They make free with the lip -- shake the head,
22.2: My God, I call by day, and Thou answerest not, And by night, and there is no silence to me.
22.6: And I [am] a worm, and no man, A reproach of man, and despised of the people.
22.31: They come and declare His righteousness, To a people that is borne, that He hath made!

44.16: Because of the voice of a reproacher and reviler, Because of an enemy and a self-avenger.
44.3: For, not by their sword Possessed they the land, And their arm gave not salvation to them, But Thy right hand, and Thine arm, And the light of Thy countenance, Because Thou hadst accepted them.
44.5: By Thee our adversaries we do push, By Thy name tread down our withstanders,
44.21: Doth not God search out this? For He knoweth the secrets of the heart.
44.18: We turn not backward our heart, Nor turn aside doth our step from Thy path.
44.12: Thou sellest Thy people -- without wealth, And hast not become great by their price.
44.10: Thou causest us to turn backward from an adversary, And those hating us, Have spoiled for themselves.
44.2: Thou, [with] Thy hand, nations hast dispossessed. And Thou dost plant them. Thou afflictest peoples, and sendest them away.
44.22: Surely, for Thy sake we have been slain all the day, Reckoned as sheep of the slaughter.
44.8: In God we have boasted all the day, And Thy name to the age we thank. Selah.
44.17: All this met us, and we did not forget Thee, Nor have we dealt falsely in Thy covenant.
44.11: Thou makest us food like sheep, And among nations Thou hast scattered us.
44.1: To the Overseer. -- By sons of Korah. An Instruction. O God, with our ears we have heard, Our fathers have recounted to us, The work Thou didst work in their days, In the days of old.
44.9: In anger Thou hast cast off and causest us to blush, And goest not forth with our hosts.
44.24: Why Thy face hidest Thou? Thou forgettest our afflictions and our oppression,
44.14: Thou makest us a simile among nations, A shaking of the head among peoples.
44.7: For Thou hast saved us from our adversaries, And those hating us Thou hast put to shame.
44.15: All the day my confusion [is] before me, And the shame of my face hath covered me.
44.20: If we have forgotten the name of our God, And spread our hands to a strange God,
44.25: For bowed to the dust hath our soul, Cleaved to the earth hath our belly.
44.23: Stir up -- why dost Thou sleep, O Lord? Awake, cast us not off for ever.
44.6: For, not in my bow do I trust, And my sword doth not save me.
44.4: Thou [art] He, my king, O God, Command the deliverances of Jacob.
44.19: But Thou hast smitten us in a place of dragons, And dost cover us over with death-shade.
44.13: Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, A scorn and a reproach to our surrounders.
44.26: Arise, a help to us, And ransom us for thy kindness' sake.

109.11: An exactor layeth a snare for all that he hath, And strangers spoil his labour.
109.3: They have compassed me about, And they fight me without cause.
109.20: This [is] the wage of mine accusers from Jehovah, And of those speaking evil against my soul.
109.12: He hath none to extend kindness, Nor is there one showing favour to his orphans.
109.10: And wander continually do his sons, Yea, they have begged, And have sought out of their dry places.
109.17: And he loveth reviling, and it meeteth him, And he hath not delighted in blessing, And it is far from him.
109.13: His posterity is for cutting off, In another generation is their name blotted out.
109.27: And they know that this [is] Thy hand, Thou, O Jehovah, Thou hast done it.
109.30: I thank Jehovah greatly with my mouth, And in the midst of many I praise Him,
109.18: And he putteth on reviling as his robe, And it cometh in as water into his midst, And as oil into his bones.
109.29: Mine accusers put on blushing, and are covered, As an upper robe [is] their shame.
109.23: As a shadow when it is stretched out I have gone, I have been driven away as a locust.
109.19: It is to him as apparel -- he covereth himself, And for a continual girdle he girdeth it on.
109.1: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. O God of my praise, be not silent,
109.5: And they set against me evil for good, And hatred for my love.
109.4: For my love they oppose me, and I -- prayer!
109.8: His days are few, his oversight another taketh,
109.26: Help me, O Jehovah my God, Save me, according to Thy kindness.
109.14: The iniquity of his fathers Is remembered unto Jehovah, And the sin of his mother is not blotted out.
109.22: For I [am] poor and needy, And my heart hath been pierced in my midst.
109.28: They revile, and Thou dost bless, They have risen, and are ashamed, And Thy servant doth rejoice.
109.25: And I -- I have been a reproach to them, They see me, they shake their head.
109.9: His sons are fatherless, and his wife a widow.
109.15: They are before Jehovah continually, And He cutteth off from earth their memorial.
109.21: And Thou, O Jehovah Lord, Deal with me for Thy name's sake, Because Thy kindness [is] good, deliver me.
109.24: My knees have been feeble from fasting, And my flesh hath failed of fatness.
109.16: Because that he hath not remembered to do kindness, And pursueth the poor man and needy, And the smitten of heart -- to slay,
109.7: In his being judged, he goeth forth wicked, And his prayer is for sin.
109.2: For the mouth of wickedness, and the mouth of deceit, Against me they have opened, They have spoken with me -- A tongue of falsehood, and words of hatred!
109.6: Appoint Thou over him the wicked, And an adversary standeth at his right hand.
109.31: For He standeth at the right hand of the needy, To save from those judging his soul.

61.7: He dwelleth to the age before God, Kindness and truth appoint -- they keep him.
61.3: For Thou hast been a refuge for me, A tower of strength because of the enemy.
61.2: From the end of the land unto Thee I call, In the feebleness of my heart, Into a rock higher than I Thou dost lead me.
61.1: To the Overseer, on stringed instruments. -- By David. Hear, O God, my loud cry, attend to my prayer.
61.4: I sojourn in Thy tent to the ages, I trust in the secret place of Thy wings. Selah.
61.6: Days to the days of the king Thou addest, His years as generation and generation.
61.5: For Thou, O God, hast hearkened to my vows, Thou hast appointed the inheritance Of those fearing Thy name.
61.8: So do I praise Thy name for ever, When I pay my vows day by day!

15.2: He who is walking uprightly, And working righteousness, And speaking truth in his heart.
15.4: Despised in his eyes [is] a rejected one, And those fearing Jehovah he doth honour. He hath sworn to suffer evil, and changeth not;
15.5: His silver he hath not given in usury, And a bribe against the innocent Hath not taken; Whoso is doing these is not moved to the age!
15.1: A Psalm of David. Jehovah, who doth sojourn in Thy tent? Who doth dwell in Thy holy hill?
15.3: He hath not slandered by his tongue, He hath not done to his friend evil; And reproach he hath not lifted up Against his neighbour.

140.3: They sharpened their tongue as a serpent, Poison of an adder [is] under their lips. Selah.
140.5: The proud hid a snare for me -- and cords, They spread a net by the side of the path, Snares they have set for me. Selah.
140.12: I have known that Jehovah doth execute The judgment of the afflicted, The judgment of the needy.
140.10: They cause to fall on themselves burning coals, Into fire He doth cast them, Into deep pits -- they arise not.
140.2: Who have devised evils in the heart, All the day they assemble [for] wars.
140.8: Grant not, O Jehovah, the desires of the wicked, His wicked device bring not forth, They are high. Selah.
140.11: A talkative man is not established in the earth, One of violence -- evil hunteth to overflowing.
140.1: To the Overseer. -- A Psalm of David. Deliver me, O Jehovah, from an evil man, From one of violence Thou keepest me.
140.9: The chief of my surrounders, The perverseness of their lips covereth them.
140.7: O Jehovah, my Lord, strength of my salvation, Thou hast covered my head in the day of armour.
140.6: I have said to Jehovah, 'My God [art] Thou, Hear, Jehovah, the voice of my supplications.'
140.4: Preserve me, Jehovah, from the hands of the wicked, From one of violence Thou keepest me, Who have devised to overthrow my steps.
140.13: Only -- the righteous give thanks to Thy name, The upright do dwell with Thy presence!

86.16: Look unto me, and favour me, Give Thy strength to Thy servant, And give salvation to a son of Thine handmaid.
86.3: Favour me, O Lord, for to Thee I call all the day.
86.5: For Thou, Lord, [art] good and forgiving. And abundant in kindness to all calling Thee.
86.12: I confess Thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart, And I honour Thy name to the age.
86.10: For great [art] Thou, and doing wonders, Thou [art] God Thyself alone.
86.2: Keep my soul, for I [am] pious, Save Thy servant -- who is trusting to Thee, O Thou, my God.
86.8: There is none like Thee among the gods, O Lord, And like Thy works there are none.
86.17: Do with me a sign for good, And those hating me see and are ashamed, For Thou, O Jehovah, hast helped me, Yea, Thou hast comforted me!
86.11: Show me, O Jehovah, Thy way, I walk in Thy truth, My heart doth rejoice to fear Thy name.
86.1: A Prayer of David. Incline, O Jehovah, Thine ear, Answer me, for I [am] poor and needy.
86.9: All nations that Thou hast made Come and bow themselves before Thee, O Lord, And give honour to Thy name.
86.14: O God, the proud have risen up against me, And a company of the terrible sought my soul, And have not placed Thee before them,
86.7: In a day of my distress I call Thee, For Thou dost answer me.
86.15: And Thou, O Lord, [art] God, merciful and gracious, Slow to anger, and abundant in kindness and truth.
86.6: Hear, O Jehovah, my prayer, And attend to the voice of my supplications.
86.4: Rejoice the soul of Thy servant, For unto Thee, O Lord, my soul I lift up.
86.13: For Thy kindness [is] great toward me, And Thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol.

26.7: To sound with a voice of confession, And to recount all Thy wonders.
26.9: Do not gather with sinners my soul, And with men of blood my life,
26.10: In whose hand [is] a wicked device, And their right hand [is] full of bribes.
26.3: For Thy kindness [is] before mine eyes, And I have walked habitually in Thy truth.
26.11: And I, in mine integrity I walk, Redeem me, and favour me.
26.2: Try me, O Jehovah, and prove me, Purified [are] my reins and my heart.
26.1: By David. Judge me, O Jehovah, for I in mine integrity have walked, And in Jehovah I have trusted, I slide not.
26.12: My foot hath stood in uprightness, In assemblies I bless Jehovah!
26.4: I have not sat with vain men, And with dissemblers I enter not.
26.6: I wash in innocency my hands, And I compass Thine altar, O Jehovah.
26.5: I have hated the assembly of evil doers, And with the wicked I sit not.
26.8: Jehovah, I have loved the habitation of Thy house, And the place of the tabernacle of Thine honour.

138.7: If I walk in the midst of distress Thou quickenest me, Against the anger of mine enemies Thou sendest forth Thy hand, And Thy right hand doth save me.
138.3: In the day I called, when Thou dost answer me, Thou dost strengthen me in my soul [with] strength.
138.2: I bow myself toward Thy holy temple, And I confess Thy name, For Thy kindness, and for Thy truth, For Thou hast made great Thy saying above all Thy name.
138.1: By David. I confess Thee, with all my heart, Before the gods I do praise Thee.
138.4: O Jehovah, all kings of earth confess Thee, When they have heard the sayings of Thy mouth.
138.6: For high [is] Jehovah, and the lowly He seeth, And the haughty from afar He knoweth.
138.5: And they sing in the ways of Jehovah, For great [is] the honour of Jehovah.
138.8: Jehovah doth perfect for me, O Jehovah, Thy kindness [is] to the age, The works of Thy hands let not fall!

36.7: How precious [is] Thy kindness, O God, And the sons of men In the shadow of Thy wings do trust.
36.9: For with Thee [is] a fountain of life, In Thy light we see light.
36.10: Draw out Thy kindness to those knowing Thee, And Thy righteousness to the upright of heart.
36.3: The words of his mouth [are] iniquity and deceit, He ceased to act prudently -- to do good.
36.11: Let not a foot of pride meet me, And a hand of the wicked let not move me.
36.2: For he made [it] smooth to himself in his eyes, To find his iniquity to be hated.
36.1: To the Overseer. -- By a servant of Jehovah, by David. The transgression of the wicked Is affirming within my heart, 'Fear of God is not before his eyes,
36.12: There have workers of iniquity fallen, They have been overthrown, And have not been able to arise!
36.4: Iniquity he deviseth on his bed, He stationeth himself on a way not good, Evil he doth not refuse.'
36.6: Thy righteousness [is] as mountains of God, Thy judgments [are] a great deep. Man and beast Thou savest, O Jehovah.
36.5: O Jehovah, in the heavens [is] Thy kindness, Thy faithfulness [is] unto the clouds.
36.8: They are filled from the fatness of Thy house, And the stream of Thy delights Thou dost cause them to drink.

38.16: When I said, 'Lest they rejoice over me, In the slipping of my foot against me they magnified themselves.
38.3: Soundness is not in my flesh, Because of Thine indignation, Peace is not in my bones because of my sin.
38.5: Stunk -- become corrupt have my wounds, Because of my folly.
38.21: Do not forsake me, O Jehovah, My God, be not far from me,
38.18: For mine iniquity I declare, I am sorry for my sin.
38.12: And those seeking my soul lay a snare, And those seeking my evil Have spoken mischievous things, And they do deceits meditate all the day.
38.10: My heart [is] panting, my power hath forsaken me, And the light of mine eyes, Even they are not with me.
38.2: For Thine arrows have come down on me, And Thou lettest down upon me Thy hand.
38.22: Haste to help me, O Lord, my salvation!
38.8: I have been feeble and smitten -- unto excess, I have roared from disquietude of heart.
38.17: For I am ready to halt, And my pain [is] before me continually.
38.11: My lovers and my friends over-against my plague stand. And my neighbours afar off have stood.
38.1: A Psalm of David, 'To cause to remember.' Jehovah, in Thy wrath reprove me not, Nor in Thy fury chastise me.
38.9: Lord, before Thee [is] all my desire, And my sighing from Thee hath not been hid.
38.14: Yea, I am as a man who heareth not, And in his mouth are no reproofs.
38.7: For my flanks have been full of drought, And soundness is not in my flesh.
38.15: Because for Thee, O Jehovah, I have waited, Thou dost answer, O Lord my God.
38.20: And those paying evil for good accuse me, Because of my pursuing good.
38.6: I have been bent down, I have been bowed down -- unto excess, All the day I have gone mourning.
38.4: For mine iniquities have passed over my head, As a heavy burden -- too heavy for me.
38.19: And mine enemies [are] lively, They have been strong, and those hating me without cause, Have been multiplied.
38.13: And I, as deaf, hear not. And as a dumb one who openeth not his mouth.

7.16: Return doth his perverseness on his head, And on his crown his violence cometh down.
7.3: O Jehovah, my God, if I have done this, If there is iniquity in my hands,
7.5: An enemy pursueth my soul, and overtaketh, And treadeth down to the earth my life, And my honour placeth in the dust. Selah.
7.12: If [one] turn not, His sword he sharpeneth, His bow he hath trodden -- He prepareth it,
7.10: My shield [is] on God, Saviour of the upright in heart!
7.2: Lest he tear as a lion my soul, Rending, and there is no deliverer.
7.8: Jehovah doth judge the peoples; Judge me, O Jehovah, According to my righteousness, And according to mine integrity on me,
7.17: I thank Jehovah, According to His righteousness, And praise the name of Jehovah Most High!
7.11: God [is] a righteous judge, And He is not angry at all times.
7.1: 'The Erring One,' by David, that he sung to Jehovah concerning the words of Cush a Benjamite. O Jehovah, my God, in Thee I have trusted, Save me from all my pursuers, and deliver me.
7.9: Let, I pray Thee be ended the evil of the wicked, And establish Thou the righteous, And a trier of hearts and reins is the righteous God.
7.14: Lo, he travaileth [with] iniquity, And he hath conceived perverseness, And hath brought forth falsehood.
7.7: And a company of peoples compass Thee, And over it on high turn Thou back,
7.15: A pit he hath prepared, and he diggeth it, And he falleth into a ditch he maketh.
7.6: Rise, O Jehovah, in Thine anger, Be lifted up at the wrath of mine adversaries, And awake Thou for me: Judgment Thou hast commanded:
7.4: If I have done my well-wisher evil, And draw mine adversary without cause,
7.13: Yea, for him He hath prepared Instruments of death, His arrows for burning pursuers He maketh.

63.7: For Thou hast been a help to me, And in the shadow of Thy wings I sing.
63.9: And they who for desolation seek my soul, Go in to the lower parts of the earth.
63.10: They cause him to run on the edge of the sword, A portion for foxes they are.
63.3: Because better [is] Thy kindness than life, My lips do praise Thee.
63.11: And the king doth rejoice in God, Boast himself doth every one swearing by Him, But stopped is the mouth of those speaking lies!
63.2: So in the sanctuary I have seen Thee, To behold Thy strength and Thine honour.
63.1: A Psalm of David, in his being in the wilderness of Judah. O God, Thou [art] my God, earnestly do I seek Thee, Thirsted for Thee hath my soul, Longed for Thee hath my flesh, In a land dry and weary, without waters.
63.4: So I bless Thee in my life, in Thy name I lift up my hands.
63.6: If I have remembered Thee on my couch, In the watches -- I meditate on Thee.
63.5: As [with] milk and fatness is my soul satisfied, And [with] singing lips doth my mouth praise.
63.8: Cleaved hath my soul after Thee, On me hath Thy right hand taken hold.

124.7: Our soul as a bird hath escaped from a snare of fowlers, The snare was broken, and we have escaped.
124.3: Then alive they had swallowed us up, In the burning of their anger against us,
124.2: Save [for] Jehovah -- who hath been for us, In the rising up of man against us,
124.1: A Song of the Ascents, by David. Save [for] Jehovah -- who hath been for us, (Pray, let Israel say),
124.4: Then the waters had overflowed us, The stream passed over our soul,
124.6: Blessed [is] Jehovah who hath not given us, A prey to their teeth.
124.5: Then passed over our soul had the proud waters.
124.8: Our help [is] in the name of Jehovah, Maker of the heavens and earth!

148.3: Praise ye Him, sun and moon, Praise ye Him, all stars of light.
148.5: They do praise the name of Jehovah, For He commanded, and they were created.
148.12: Young men, and also maidens, Aged men, with youths,
148.10: The wild beast, and all cattle, Creeping thing, and winged bird,
148.2: Praise ye Him, all His messengers, Praise ye Him, all His hosts.
148.8: Fire and hail, snow and vapour, Whirlwind doing His word;
148.11: Kings of earth, and all peoples, Chiefs, and all judges of earth,
148.1: Praise ye Jah! Praise ye Jehovah from the heavens, Praise ye Him in high places.
148.9: The mountains and all heights, Fruit tree, and all cedars,
148.14: And He exalteth the horn of His people, The praise of all His saints, Of the sons of Israel, a people near Him. Praise ye Jah!
148.7: Praise ye Jehovah from the earth, Dragons and all deeps,
148.6: And He establisheth them for ever to the age, A statute He gave, and they pass not over.
148.4: Praise ye Him, heavens of heavens, And ye waters that are above the heavens.
148.13: They praise the name of Jehovah, For His name alone hath been set on high, His honour [is] above earth and heavens.

95.7: For He [is] our God, and we the people of His pasture, And the flock of His hand, To-day, if to His voice ye hearken,
95.9: Where your fathers have tried Me, Have proved Me, yea, have seen My work.
95.10: Forty years I am weary of the generation, And I say, 'A people erring in heart -- they! And they have not known My ways:'
95.3: For a great God [is] Jehovah, And a great king over all gods.
95.11: Where I sware in Mine anger, 'If they come in unto My rest -- !'
95.2: We come before His face with thanksgiving, With psalms we shout to Him.
95.1: Come, we sing to Jehovah, We shout to the rock of our salvation.
95.4: In whose hand [are] the deep places of earth, And the strong places of hills [are] His.
95.6: Come in, we bow ourselves, and we bend, We kneel before Jehovah our Maker.
95.5: Whose is the sea, and He made it, And His hands formed the dry land.
95.8: Harden not your heart as [in] Meribah, As [in] the day of Massah in the wilderness,
